Soad took a Murabha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her work. By taking this loan, Soad will be able to increase her productivity and provide a better quality product. 

Soad appears in the photo while she is working.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her work.

loans.name: Maria Elvia

texts.es: María, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive en el municipio de Villanueva, Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Lleva 10 años dedicándose a la venta de mercadería, vende ropa nueva como blusas, bóxeres, calcetas, cameras, cortinas, toallas, sandalias, pastas y  artículos para el hogar. Esta actividad la realiza en forma ambulante y por pedidos. Esta solicitando 5,800 Lempiras, para comprar mercadería como ropa, sandalias, pastas, y artículos para el hogar y aprovechar la temporada de navidad. Con esta inversión va poder tener mas producto y espera incrementar sus ganancias. Tiene como plan hacer crecer el negocio y que sus hijos puedan graduarse.
texts.en:
María, 36, is married and has two children.  She lives in the municipality of Villanueva, Cortes.  She has always worked as a merchant and for ten years has been selling new clothing such as blouses, boxers, socks, bedspreads, curtains, towels, sandals, pastas and other home products.  She works as a street vendor and on an order basis.

María is requesting 5,800 HNL to buy goods such as clothing, sandals, pastas and home products to take advantage of the Christmas season.  With this investment she hopes to have more products to sell and increase her profits.  Her goal is to expand her business so her children can graduate.

loans.use: To buy clothing, sandals, home products, pastas, etc.

loans.name: Dorca

texts.en:
Dorca is a young farmer who lives in Nyamira with her four children, all of whom are of school-going age. She produces and sells milk, eggs, maize, bananas and vegetables. She has been farming for six years. What she enjoys most about farming is planting maize because they usually do very well in Nyamira. Her challenges are insufficient funds and livestock diseases.

Dorca chose Juhudi Kilimo because they offer low interest rates for their loans. During the MFI training offered by Juhudi Kilimo, she learned that they give loans to low-income earners in order to help them boost their lives. She says that this loan will help her to purchase poultry. This will lead to more egg production and thus more income for her family and thus improve their livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Meet Gladys who has just ventured into farming. She lives in Nyamira and has two children who are of school-going age. She has been farming for two years. She produces and sells milk, tea and eggs. She enjoys poultry farming because her chickens produce a lot of eggs for selling.

Gladys chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because the offices are easily accessible and it's easy to process the loans. She plans to undertake poultry farming because it will help her pay the school fees for her children and also improve her family's wellbeing.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Tokachini Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bishano est une commerçante et membre de l’association d’affaires «Tokachini » entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 44 ans et mère de 10 enfants, dont 8 étudient et deux sont encore gosses. La cliente est  une vendeuse de farine de manioc. Elle fait ses activités dans le marché  de la place. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari après  récoltes agricoles. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs de farine de manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir  ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs, qui sont exclues du système bancaire classique,surtout ; pendant ce moment pénible de guerres à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Bishano is a trader, experienced entrepreneur and member of the business group 'Tokachini'.  She is 44 years old, and mother to ten children, eight of whom attend school and two who are still too young.  Bishano sells cassava flour at the local market.  She started her business with the help of her husband and his agricultural business.  Later, she started working with the field partner, Hekima, and their loans.  Bishano has been running her business for ten years.

She will use her loan to buy two sacks of cassava flour.  In this way, she will be able to educate, clothe and feed her children.  

Bishano  would like to warmly thank Hekima for helping women entrepreneurs, who are excluded from the normal banking system, to become independent.  This is particularly important during this difficult time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Asma'

texts.en:
Asma' is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Asma' is 19 years old and from Nablus. She lives with her husband in a small house. 

Asma's husband works in a small bakery that he owns. He has had the bakery for eight months, and it is a good business and provides a good income. 

Asma' took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new oven for her husband's bakery. By taking this loan, Asma's husband will be able to increase his productivity and his income.

loans.use: to buy a new oven for her husband's bakery.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is a 58-year-old married man from Deir Al-Balah. He is the father of two sons and two daughers. 

For the past five years, Sulaiman has worked using a tractor he owns. He works with many farmers in his city. It is a good business, and he earns a good income. However, his tractor needs to be repaired, and he does not have enough money to fix it.

Sulaiman has requested a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to repair his tractor so he can get back to work. This will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his tractor so he can get back to work.

loans.name: Mélé

texts.fr: Mélé  est une jeune femme de 33ans. Elle est commerçante de profession et revend des pagnes et des bijoux dans la zone portuaire depuis 2011. Le second crédit sollicité à WAGES lui servira d’acheter des marchandises (pagnes et bijoux) afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité par l’ouverture d’une boutique et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mélé, age 33, is a trained retailer. She's been reselling "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and jewelry in the harbor area since 2011.

She's seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, that she will use to buy supplies (pagnes and jewelry) in order to better meet her customers' needs.

She wants to reinvest in her business by opening a store, and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and jewelry

loans.name: Lomkpledji -Djokoto Vogan Group

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des produits de détails (mais, noix de palme pour la préparation du sodabi, paniers...) pour renforcer leurs activités, le groupement constitué de femmes et d'hommes sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Le profit leur permettront de faire évoluer leurs activités et d'assurer un avenir radieux à la famille. Le responsable mr Koffi né en 1972 est père de 06 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. Il est producteur de la boisson locale(SODABI) depuis 1993 et est aidée par 02 personnes.
texts.en:
The Lomkpledji-Djokoto Vogan Group is made up of men and women.  They are requesting this first loan in order to buy merchandise to improve their businesses.  They will buy retail products such as maize, palm nuts to prepare sodabi (a local drink), and baskets.

The group will use their earnings to develop their businesses and ensure a better future for their families.  

Koffi, the group representative, was born in 1972 and is father to six children, of whom three attend school.  He has been producing a local drink called sodabi since 1993 and is helped by two people.

loans.use: to buy various products for retail.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter plus de marchandises(œufs et boissons)pour revendre à ses clients, Amélé fait sa toute première demande à WAGES pour atteindre ses objectifs. Elle a démarré en 2009 et espère à l'avenir agrandir son activité tout en assurant le bien - être de la famille. Âgée de 39ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant de 14ans scolarisé.
texts.en:
In order to reach her goal and  buy more supplies (eggs and beverages) to resell to her customers, Amélé is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES.

She started her business in 2009, and hopes to expand it in the future, while ensuring the well-being of her family.

Amélé is 39 years old, married, and the mother of one 14-year-old child who goes to school.

loans.use: to buy eggs and beverages

loans.name: Jovelin

texts.en:
Jovelin is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like cream, chips, bread, canned goods, eggs, etc for her general store business.

Jovelin has been in this business for four years. Jovelin earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Jovelin has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like cream, chips, bread, canned goods and eggs.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora  Gregoria   de 44 años de edad, vive con su esposo  y sus tres hijos, tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 04 años al negocio de venta de tortillas, sus clientes le visitan en su casa.
Doña Gregoria con la ayuda de sus dos hijas  trabaja haciendo tortillas todo los días de lunes a domingo, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene más de tres ciclos de trabajar con Prisma y  a demostrado buen  comportamiento de pago en sus préstamos y además desea negociar con ropa para esta época de navidad.
Doña Gregoria está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña, cal, blusas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, etc. Con el apoyo de este crédito desea comprar por mayor la materia prima para realizar su negocio y  comprar ropa nueva para vender a sus clientes un producto adicional a sus tortillas.
Doña Gregoria de esa forma espera tener mejores ganancias, su sueño es mejorar su casa y mejorar su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Gregoria, 44, lives with her husband and three children in their own house.  For four years she has been selling tortillas to the customers who visit her home.

With the help of her daughters, Gregoria makes tortillas every day, Monday through Sunday.  She is a hard worker and has borrowed loans through Prisma on three occasions, with a good payment record.  This Christmas season she also wants to sell clothing.

Gregoria is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood, lime water and blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, etc.  With the support of the loan she wants to buy more raw materials for her business and buy clothing to sell as a new product line.

She hopes to earn more profits.  Her dream is to improve her house and quality of life.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2013.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood and lime water, and blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Casildo

texts.es: El señor Casildo vive en concubinato y tiene 2 hijos, compro un terreno urbano en el que vive actualmente, y un lote agricola en el cual se dedica a la produccion de piña y platano. Debido a que sus ingresos disminuyeron por el bajo costo de sus productos afectados por cambios climaticos y plagas,  solicita un credito para terminar la construccion de su vivienda  ya que quedo paralizada por falta de recursos economicos. Actualmente su productos se encuentran en buen estado asi que podra venderlos y obtener ingresos por ellos, su principal objetivo es trabajar arduamente para cubrir todos los gastos y mejorar las condiciones en las que vive su familia.
texts.en: Casildo is in a common law marriage and has 2 children. He bought a city lot where he lives now, and an agricultural lot where he grows pineapple and plantains. Due to the fact that his income went down because of the low price of his crops, affected by weather changes and pests, he is asking for a loan to finish building his house. He had to stop due to a lack of resources. Right now, his crops are doing well so he will be able to sell them and get income from them. His main objective is to work hard and cover all of his expenses and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to build his house.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 23-year-old single man from Jabalia. His father works in construction, but he does not have a stable income. 

Mahmoud is a student at a local university where he studies Islamic Studies. He would like to finish his education and find a job in the future. 

Mahmoud requested a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to do his homework and to read articles online.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Sari Rasa Group

texts.en:
Sari Rasa group succeeded in repaying their loan even though it was a few days from the due date. This was due to the inexpensive price of piglets today. Most of the group members keep sows and sell piglets. Because they are selling the piglets at the same time, the price of piglets goes down.

Ni Luh, as head of the group, feels the same thing. Luckily, she has an additional business as a farmer so that she does not lack everyday items. Ni Luh and all members of Sari Rasa group agreed to continue borrowing but changed the method of raising pigs to increase the selling price.

Sari Rasa group have resumed their lending from MUK. To increase the price of piglets, they changed the method of raising their pigs. Some members still keep sows and the other members keep super quality pigs for fattening or local pigs for pork roll. With this method, the sales of pigs will remain in this second group only. The members who have sows, will sell their piglets to the other members who raise pigs and fatten them for pork roll. The members who fatten pigs for pork roll will sell their pigs to the big buyers. 

Ni Luh, as the head of the group, wasn’t able to attend the meeting because of illness. She was represented by the treasurer, Ni Nyoman. Ni Nyoman, in addition to being a pig breeder, also has a small kiosk in front of her house. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase piglets, feed and also snacks for her kiosk. She hopes all the efforts that they make will go well and that can earn a satisfactory profit.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and also snacks for her kiosk.

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en:
Mousa is an 18-year-old single man from Jabalia. Mousa's father is a painter, but he doesn't have a stable income due to lack of demand. Mousa is a student in a local university where he studies science. He would like to finish his studies and find a job in the future. 

Mousa requested a loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mousa will be able to do his homework and read articles online.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 39-year-old married man from Rafah. He has one son and three daughters. 

Ayman works as an employee in the public sector but has a low income. He also has a small plot of land where he grows crops in greenhouses to insure good quality. He gained this experience from his father. 

Ayman took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy the materials needed to build new greenhouses. By taking this loan, Ayman will be able to sell his crops to local traders.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to build new greenhouses.

loans.name: Blanca Ester

texts.es: Doña Blanca, tiene 62 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 2 hijos y vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Ella lleva 14 años de  tener su propio negocio donde vende comida como pastelitos, tajadas con carne, baleadas, refrescos y dulces. Este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener activo el negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 10,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de refrescos, churros, confites, chicles, galletas, cacahuates, tajadas de plátano y jugos. Esta inversión le ayudara a diversificar sus productos y a incrementar las ventas. Sus metas son asegurar su vejez, ayudar a sus hijos y nietos y tratar de mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en: Blanca is 62 years old. She is single from widowhood. She has 2 children and lives in the town of Tela, Atlántida. For 14 years, she has had her own business where she sells food such as pastries, meats, baleadas, beverages and candies. This business is located in her house. She has asked for several loans to maintain her business. Right now, she is asking for another loan of 10,000 Lempiras. She will invest it in buying beverages, churros, candies, gum, cookies, peanuts, plantain chips and juices. This investment will help her to diversify her products and increase her sales. Her goals are to be secure in her old age, help her children and grandchildren, and try to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beverages, churros, candies, gum, cookies, peanuts, plantain chips and juice to sell.

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es: El señor Gualberto tiene 34 años de edad, vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos. Trabaja como agricultor con la producción de piña y también en la construcción de viviendas de madera. Cuenta con su propio lote agrícola y un lote urbano en el que vive junto a su familia.  Actualmente solicita un crédito para  el mantenimiento de piña y compra de fertilizantes, de esa manera podrá tener mejores productos y mayores ingresos para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gualberto is 34 years old. He is in a common law marriage and has three children. He works as a farmer, growing pineapple. He also builds wooden houses. He has his own farmland and a city lot where he lives with his family. Right now, he is asking for a loan to do maintenance on the pineapple crop and to buy fertilizer. this way, he can have better crops and more income to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his pineapple crop and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito is selling beverages, grocery items and vegetables in his village. Early in the morning he travels to the market to ensure that all the vegetables he will purchase in the market are fresh. 

He wants to have satisfactory services which is why he keeps products available to meet his customers' demand. He wants to take a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy grocery items and vegetables to sell. 

He hopes for continuous growth of his business and to earn higher income so that he can continue sending his children to school.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is married with five children and runs a general store in their community to make a living. She has been doing this for three years and she earns well for the family. 

She joined GDMPC a year ago, and recently she took a new loan from its micro-finance services to purchase more grocery goods to resell. 

Andresa is hopeful that she will improve her business so as to gain more income so her family can have better living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.fr: Monsieur Innocent est un Infirmier Technicien de Laboratoire dans un centre hospitalier.  Ce client est parent d’un élève à l’école primaire. Il a été informé de nouvelles opportunités de financer anticipativement le frais scolaires par l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais scolaires  pour son enfant en fin qu’il ne soit plus exclu de cours durant toute l’année scolaire 2013-2014. Ce parent infirmier, rêve voir  son enfant  devenir ingénieur  chef d’entreprise. Il remercie l’IMF Hekima pour son nouveau produit innovant dédié  à l’éducation de leurs enfants en leur donnant de crédit d’impact social surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Innocent is a laboratory nurse-technician in a hospital.  He is the father of a child who attends primary school, and has been advised of an opportunity to work with the field partner, Hekima, to pay school fees in advance.  He will, therefore, use his loan to pay the school fees of his child and avoid the child being excluded from class during the school year, 2013-2014.

This man, who works as a nurse, dreams of seeing his child become a Chief Engineer.  

Innocent would like to thank Hekima for this new product, designed to improve the education of children.  This loan will have a large impact socially, especially during this time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia runs a retail store in her community to make a living. She has been selling different kinds of clay pots, earning well to support the family. She has taken a loan from GDMPC micro credit for she has been a member for more than two years now. 

She used this loan to buy clay and assorted pots to sell. In the future, Julia wants to become successful in this line of business so that she can provide a better living for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy clay and assorted pots to sell.

loans.name: Maria Raimunda

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer de 42 años de edad luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria completo y junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos se han podido superar gracias a la dedicación en la actividad del cultivo de papa ya que con ella también vive 4 nietos. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad ya que aprendió hace más de 20 años esta actividad dirigida e inculcada por sus padres la cual hasta hoy en día siguen ejerciendo. Este es el único medio de ingreso para su familia por medio de la cual se han superado y han podido salir adelante. La propiedad que en familia trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia de sus padres la cual está ubicada a 5 minutos de su casa de habitación. Hoy en día Doña María junto a su esposo trabajan duro para que sus hijos no dejen de estudiar y tengan un mejor futuro, un mejor estilo de vida y mejores oportunidades en la vida. Su producto es comercializado a través de intermediarios que llegan a la zona, vecinos y ellos mismos que viajan hasta la zona de comercio para su venta.
Actualmente Doña María solicita ayuda para poder invertir en la siembra y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos como: 2 cajas de papa de primera calidad para cultivar, 2 QQ de abono, 1 QQ de Nitrato de amonio, 1 QQ de K-C-L, 1 sobre de curatane, 1 royo de manguera entre otros con los que asistirá sus cultivos.  
Su sueño es ser una productora de hortalizas en cantidades mayores y ser la mejor de la zona en su producción; también poder comprar un pedazo más de tierra para dar a sus hijos y que ellos puedan construir sus hogares.
texts.en:
María is a 42-year-old woman. She is a hardworking person who finished primary school. Together with her husband and five children, she has been able to get ahead thanks to the effort they put into growing potatoes. She also lives with four grandchildren. She has a lot of experience in this activity. She learned 20 years ago, taught by her parents, who are still working today. This is the family’s only source of income, and their means to get ahead and better themselves.

They own the land where they work, thanks to an inheritance from their parents. It is located five minutes away from their house. At present, María and her husband work hard so that their children can continue studying and can have a better future, a better quality of life and more opportunities in life. Their produce is sold through middlemen, to neighbors or at the marketplace, where they take it and sell it.

María is requesting a loan to sow and give maintenance to the plantations. She will buy two boxes of high-quality potato seeds, two quintals compost, one quintal ammonia nitrate, one quintal potassium chloride, a bag of Curathane (fungicide), a hose and some other materials she needs to give maintenance to her plantations.

Her dream is to increase her production of vegetables and become the best farmer in the region. She would also like to buy more land for her children, so that they can build their houses there.

loans.use: to buy certified potato seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Thoeurn is from the village of Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province. He is 35 years old, married and has four children. To make a living, Thoeurn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. His wife help him earns income by running a general store from their house selling different kinds of household products.

In order to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions, Thoeurn has applied for a loan to support the construction of a household latrine, which is a form of sanitation improvement. This loan will be his first loan. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Thoeurn is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of his family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to support the construction of a household latrine.

loans.name: Luc Olivier

texts.fr: Luc est un jeune homme  de 33 ans marié et père de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 4 et 10 ans. il a aussi 6 autres personnes à sa charge. il est commerçant et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (tomates)  dans un marché de la place depuis 8 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine et souhaiterai augmenter son stock de cajots de tomates ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Luc is a young, married man.  He is 33 years old and father to three children between four and ten years old.  He is also responsible for six other people. 

 Luc is a trader and has sold fresh produce (tomatoes) in a local market for eight years.  He knows his suppliers and customers very well.  He has built up his customer base over the years, thanks to his experience in his business.

He will use his loan to increase his stock of tomato crates, which will allow him to meet the continuing demand of his customers, and avoid running out of stock.

Luc will save his earnings to help improve his business and also provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of tomato crates.

loans.name: Sany's Group

texts.en:
Sany, 40, is from a rural village located in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She is married with four children. She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice and planting cassava for 22 years. The current business earns her about 26,000 KHR per day.

Sany has been with VisionFund for three cycles and she has completely paid back the past loan which helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy and cassava so as to make living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
Vanna is a 35-year-old father of three children living in a rural village of the Siem Reap district, Cambodia. To make a living, he and his wife have been farming rice on 3.5 hectare of farmland for almost 17 years. The current business earns them about 29,700 KHR per day. 

This is the third microloan for Vanna with VisionFund. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income so as to make a living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: El señor Alfredo tiene 32 años de edad, se dedica a la prestación de servicios como chapero, nunca se casó pero tuvo 3 hijas las cuales viven con su madre en el extranjero. Tiene una chapería propia y solicita un crédito para comprar pintura, masilla plástica, lijas y lo necesario para chapería, debido a que están llegando vehículos de chile y requiere más material para refaccionarlos y ponerlos en un buen estado, de esta forma incrementará sus ingresos y hará crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 32 years old. He does body work on cars. He never got married but had three daughters that live with their mother abroad.

He has his own workshop and is requesting a loan to buy paint, plastic filler, sandpaper and other things needed for his job. A lot of cars are coming from Chile and he needs more material to repair them and leave them in a good condition. This way, his income will increase and his business will grow.

loans.use: to buy materials for his workshop, such as paint, filler and sandpaper.

loans.name: Abshir Abdilahi

texts.en: Abshir Abdilahi is 20 years old. He studies at Gollis University, Faculty of Computer Engineering. He needs a laptop to prepare university assignments and read lessons when given in soft copy. Buying a laptop on his own is the biggest challenge he has faced in his learning process. Lecturers use a projector during classes and give the students a soft copy of the lessons. Getting the laptop will help him to improve his lesson preparation. Now he is waiting for a laptop that Kaaba will provide him, which he will pay for in monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Khadar Mahamoud

texts.en: Khadar Mahamoud is 26 years old. He studies at Gollis University, Faculty of Civil Engineering and he is a senior student. He needs a laptop to prepare university assignments and read lessons when given in soft copy and also to write his graduation thesis book. Buying a laptop on his own is the biggest challenge he has faced in his learning process. Lecturers use a projector during classes and give the students a soft copy of the lessons. Now he is waiting for a laptop that Kaaba will provide him which he will pay for in monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Gloria is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, fruits, etc for her food-vending business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, milk and fruits.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy has sold woven "nipa" palms leaves for more than ten years now earning well to fulfill her needs. She is single and supports her parents. 

She has been a member of GDMPC for more than two years and recently, she took a new loan to purchase more palm leaves to weave. In the future, Jimmy wants to improve her business to have a better source of income.

loans.use: to purchase more palm leaves to weave.

loans.name: Oneyda Carolina

texts.es:
La joven Oneyda Carolina  21 años de edad, vive con su esposo  y su hijo, tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 02 año al negocio de venta de ropa usada y abarrotería, su venta es de forma ambulante y en su casa.
Oneyda sale a los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo, en su motocicleta a vender dichos productos, es una joven que tiene buenas ideas para salir de su condición económica ya que viene de una familia muy pobre y ella esta luchando junto con su pareja para mejorar su condición de vida.
Oneyda está solicitando el préstamo para compra de churros, café, pan, azúcar, frijoles, arroz, frescos, etc. en esta ocasión no invertirá casi en ropa ya que la quisieron asaltar en su motocicleta cuando andaba vendiendo en los barrios y por seguridad solo desea quedarse en casa vendiendo en su pequeña pulpería que desea surtir, es su segundo préstamo que solicita.
Oneyda su sueño es mejorar su condición de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Oneyda Carolina is 21 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and son.  For two years Oneyda has had a business selling used clothes, and groceries. She operates as a street vendor and sells out of her home.

Oneyda goes out on her motorcycle to the local neighbourhoods in San Lorenzo to sell her products.  A young woman, Oneyda has good ideas for how to get ahead financially as she comes from a very poor family and is fighting, alongside her husband, to have better living conditions.

Oneyda is applying for a loan in order to buy churros, coffee, bread, sugar, beans, rices, and more.  On this occasion she will invest almost nothing in clothes as she was once robbed on her motorcycle when carrying such items.  For her own safety, Oneyda wants to stay at home selling from her small grocery store, which she wants to stock up.  This is Oneyda's second loan.

Oneyda's dream is to improve her living conditions.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, November 2013

loans.use: to buy churros, coffee, bread, sugar, beans, rice, and more for her business.

loans.name: Marie Cécile

texts.fr: Marie Cécile est une femme de 51 ans célibataire et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (manioc, plantains, macabo et arachides) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 16 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter son stock de sacs de macabos ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Cécile is a 51-year-old, single mother of four children.  She is a trader and has sold fresh, seasonal food products (cassava, plantains, macabo - a tuber similar to taro root - and peanuts) at a local market for sixteen years.

She has a good knowledge of her suppliers, and the customers who she has built up over the years, thanks to her experience in her business.  However, she often runs out of stock, as she has to sell all her produce before she can afford to buy more.  She would like to increase her stock of sacks of macabo to satisfy her customer's needs and avoid running out of stock in the future.

Marie Cécile will save her earnings to improve the size of her business and also, provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stocks of sacks of macabo.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 45 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Wilma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Wilma has been farming rice for 8 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like butter, sugar, milk, etc. for her food-vending business.

Cecilia has been in this business for 20 years. Cecilia earns additional income from meat-vending.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like butter, sugar and milk for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 59 years old and widowed with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Victoria is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and earns additional income from food vending.

Margarita is borrowing 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase more stock of spices to sell. Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of spices to sell

loans.name: Om-Awla Group

texts.en: This group is called Om-Awla and consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. Nawal is a 39-year-old married woman who lives with her children in Sana`a. She works hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothing. She is a teacher and dreams of raising her children well. She lives with her family in bad conditions. She would like to buy furniture to use in her small house, but she suffers from a lack of money so she is applying for a loan of 50,000 YER. In the future, she hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use in her small house.

loans.name: Al-Yasmeen Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Yasmeen and consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 110,000 YER. 

Rabab is 27 years old. She is a married woman and has children. She already has experience selling basic necessity products like food to assist her husband in covering household expenses. She has been involved in this business for two years and her primary customers are local residents. From this, she earns a small amount which is not enough for her family's sustenance. She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy food items for resale. She wishes to keep improving her business to be able to obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to buy food items for resale.

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en: Hamid is a 43-year-old married man who has children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has always been characterized as being a person who very much wants to get ahead and this has allowed him to overcome the great difficulties life has presented him. His business consists of selling retail items such as gifts, cosmetics and accessories for woman. His daily income isn't enough to cover his big family's needs. He wants to expand and buy new merchandise to meet the demands of various groups of customers so he applied for a loan of 400,000 YER from AMB to buy cosmetics and accessories for woman to use. In this way, he hopes his business will grow and that his customers will find good service and a wide variety of products in his store. He hopes his store will generate higher income so that he can offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and accessories for woman to use.

loans.name: Dhiab

texts.en: Dhiab is a 36-year-old man who is always cheerful in his everyday life according to the residents of his neighborhood. He is a married man and lives in Ibb, Yemen. He is the breadwinner of the family. He sells ice cream  which he offers to his customers in exchange for goods and services. He is trying to do everything so that his family will not need for anything. He intends to buy home appliances for his house, but inadequate capital and inflation mean he may not achieve what he needs. So, he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy a washing machine and refrigerator to use in his house. He hopes to expand his ice cream store so that he can attract more clients and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and refrigerator to use in his house.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, tiene 50 años de edad, esta soltera, tiene 5 hijos, vive en el municipio de Puerto Cortés junto a tres de sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida tipo bufet, vende desayuno, almuerzos y  baleadas. El negocio lo tiene hace 2 años y lo establece  a la orilla de la calle. Siempre le a gustado esta actividad.  Esta solicitando el cuarto ciclo de préstamo y es por 6,000 lempiras,  el cual lo invertirá, en la compra de más producto para elaborar comidas como arroz, frijoles, verduras, carnes, pastas, manteca, harina, condimentos etc. Y le ayudara a tener más variedad de comidas para ofrecer  a sus clientes. Tiene como meta agrandar el negocio, para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Lucia is 50 years old, single, and has five children. She lives in the Puerto Cortés municipality with three of her children.  Lucia makes a living selling buffet style food. She sells breakfasts, lunches, and stuffed flour tortillas.  Lucia has had the business for two years, and she works on the side of the street. She has always liked this work.  Lucia is applying for a fourth loan, this time for 6000 Lempira.  She will invest this in buying more products such as rice, beans, vegetables, meats, pastas, butter, flour, condiments, and more, in order to prepare meals.  The loan will help Lucia to have a great variety of meals to offer her customers.  Lucia's big goal is to expand the business, in order to make higher profits.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, beans, vegetables, meats, pastas, butter, flour, condiments, and more, in order to prepare meals.

loans.name: Ream's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Srey Snom district where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Ream is a 43-year-old mother of six dependent children. She and her husband have been engaged in rice farming and cassava planting for 25 years. These are the main sources of the family’s income. They can earn about 42,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
This is the first loan for Ream with VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Ream is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy so as to make living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ma Leonor

texts.es:
Ma Leonor tiene 34 años de edad, madre de 2 hijos quienes estudian en diferentes grados de educación en la primaria en la escuela de la comunidad los cuales viven bajo su techo en compañía de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra y cultivo de papa. Ella es ama de casa, agricultora y comerciante, con más de 10 años de experiencia siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra desde muy pequeña. Ella tiene 9 años de educación gracias al apoyo financiero y moral de sus padres quienes le apoyaron para que terminara el ciclo común básico. El terreno que ella en compañía de su esposo trabaja es propio gracias a una herencia de sus padres el cual está ubicado a 5 minutos de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando diariamente para dar asistencia a sus cultivos de hortalizas. 
Ella ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder comprar insumos agrícolas los cuales serán utilizados para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de hortalizas ya que necesita mantener protegidos de plagas, enfermedades entre otros logrando obtener una buena ganancia al final de la cosecha.
Los planes a futuro poder ampliar más sus cultivos de papa por medio de la compra de tierra siendo sus sueños darles a sus hijos la oportunidad de obtener una buena educación a nivel universitario verlos crecer como personas y como profesionales ya que es lo menos que ellos se merecen.
texts.en:
Ma Leonor is 34 years old and a mother to two children, both of whom are attending the local primary school.  Ma lives with her children and her husband, who makes a living in farming, sowing and growing potatoes.  Ma is a housewife, farmer and businesswoman.  She has ten years of experience, having learned to work the land from a young age with her parents.  Ma completed nine years at school, thanks to the moral and financial support she received from her parents, allowing her finish her basic education.  Thanks to the inheritance her parents left her, Ma owns the land she works.  It is five minutes from her home and she gets there on foot to tend to her vegetable crops.

Ma has applied for a loan from "COMIXMUL" in order to buy supplies to support and look after her vegetable crops.  Ma needs to keep the plants protected from plagues, diseases, and other factors, in order to make a good profit at the end of the harvest.

Ma's future plans are to expand her potato crops further by buying more land..  She dreams of giving her children the opportunity to have a good university education and to watch them grow as people and professionals. This is the least that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to support and look after her vegetable crops.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe has been a farmer for many years and, with the help of Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC), she was able to improve her farm with her previous loan and has successfully repaid it. As years went by, she was engaged in a retailing business selling dried fish and also cosmetics products. Recently, she requested a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional dried fish and cosmetic products. She wants to have a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish and cosmetic products

loans.name: Lane

texts.en:
Lane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling food supplement products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. Lane earns additional income from reflexology.

Lane is borrowing 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy additional boxes of food supplement products to sell. Lane has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of food supplement products to sell

loans.name: Nyanga

texts.fr: NYANGA est une femme célibataire qui vit dans un quartier de la capitale. Mère de famille, elle tient un petit hangar où elle propose diverses qualités de fruits en l'occurrence des papayes, des oranges, des mandarines, des ananas, des lemons, des citrons et des pamplemousses. Grâce à sa détermination et sa sympathie elle s'est faite une clientèle de renom dont elle aimerait toujours assouvir les besoins en fruits. Elle sollicite à nouveau ce crédit pour effectuer des achats en grande quantité dans les campagnes. Les bénéfices tirés de cet emprunt lui permettront d'augmenter son capital et par ricochet d'agrandir son commerce tout en subvenait aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Nyanga is a single woman who lives in an area of the capital city.  She has children, and runs a small stall selling various fruit, for example papayas, oranges, mandarins, pineapples, lemons and grapefruit.

As a result of her determination and friendliness, she has built up an impressive clientele who she strives to satisfy.

Nyanga will use her loan to buy large quantities of produce in the countryside.  The earnings that she will make will be used to increase her working capital, improve the size of her business and meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy produce in bulk from the countryside, for resale in town.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
Babacar, est un jeune tailleur qui a appris le métier de tailleur depuis 2004. Il lui a ensuite fallu mettre de l’argent de coté afin de pouvoir ouvrir son propre atelier. Quelques temps après, il y associe la mercerie. Il vient solliciter un appui financier pour acheter des garnitures : popeline, fil, renfort, boutons, fermetures… et mettre dans sa mercerie. Quand il a des tissus à coudre, il n’est pas obligé d’aller au marché, mais il prend sur place ce dont il a besoin en le taxant dans la main d’œuvre. Babacar est actif durant toute la journée et durant même la nuit s’il a des commandes qui pressent. 
Babacar est célibataire et vit avec ses parents, il participe à la gestion du foyer en payant l’électricité.
Il veut un jour, si son capital augmente, diversifier son activité et augmenter ses bénéfices.
texts.en: Babacar is a young tailor who has been involved in this trade since 2004. He then put money aside in order to open his own workshop. At a later date, he came up with the idea of developing a fabric shop. He is asking for a loan in order to purchase materials to furnish the fabric shop: poplin, string, lining, buttons, zippers. When he has fabric to sew, he will no longer be obliged to go to the market, and can be furnished onsite by his own fabric shop. Babacar is very active and works all day long, sometimes even through the evenings if he has pressing customer orders. He is single and lives with his parents, and contributes to the family's needs by paying electricity bills. In the future, he would like to diversify his commercial activity in order to increase his revenues.

loans.use: purchase articles from a fabric shop in order to sew and resell other goods

loans.name: Solangie

texts.es: Solangie es una joven de 28 años de edad, madre de una niña y soltera. Vive en unión libre con el padre de su hija. Trabajadora y con mucho entusiasmo de crecer en su actividad. Ella inició su negocio con el objetivo de generar ingresos y ayudar a su compañero en el hogar aprovechando la oportunidad que se le presentaba,asi de igual manera sentirse con independencia económica. Se dedica al comercio desde hace tres años y le va muy bien, gracias al buen trato y facilidad que le brinda a sus clientes. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia cuando tiene que salir a vender o cobrar su mercadería. Ella solicita financiamiento en éstos momentos para reforzar su venta de sandalías reef y roxy de mujer y de hombre. Su meta es superarse y crecer tanto a nivel personal como de negocios, asi mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Solangie is a young woman, age 28.  She is the mother of one daughter and is single.  She lives in a common-law relationship with the father of her daughter.  She is hardworking and is very enthusiastic to grow in her work.  

Taking advantage of an opportunity that presented itself to her, she began her business with an aim to generate income and help her partner in the home, and thus in the same way to feel economically independent.  For three years she has worked in retail, and it is going really well for her, thanks to the good manner and straightforwardness she has with her customers.  She counts on the support of her family when she has to go out to sell or collect money for her merchandise.  

She is asking for a loan right now to strengthen her sales of Reef and Roxy brand sandals for women and men.  Her goal is to outdo herself and grow on a personal level as well as that of a businesswoman, and in this way to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's sandals

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
Né vers 1976 à Kadiana (une sous-préfecture de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali), Abdou y  réside   avec sa femme et ses 3 enfants  dans une famille traditionnelle.
 Abdou  s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales. Il est très sollicité au marché de Kadiana, et surtout le jour de foire. 
Fort de ses 15 années d’expériences dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  premier  prêt.
Mr Abdou compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des céréales (2tonnes et 1/2 de maïs +  1tonne et ½ de sorgho).   Il s’approvisionne chez les producteurs dans les villages avoisinants  Kadiana. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché à une clientèle mixte.
Mr Abdou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 107.500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Abdou was born around 1976 in Kadiana, one of the sub-prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali.  He still lives there, in a traditional family unit, with his wife and three children.

Abdou started working at a young age, buying and selling cereals, he now has fifteen years' experience in his business.  He is much sought after at the market in Kadiana, particularly on fair days.

Abdou works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, to improve his business and satisfy the ever-growing needs of his customers.  This will be his first loan with the field partner.

Abdou will use his loan to buy cereals (2 1/2 tonnes of maize and 1 1/2 tonnes of sorghum).  He buys his supplies from producers in the villages around Kadiana, and sells his product on a cash or credit basis, at the market to a mixed clientele.

Abdou hopes to earn 107,500 francs CFA per month, and will use his earnings to provide for the needs of his family, repay his loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1980 à TOUSSEGUELA, une sous-préfecture de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali, Kadiatou  réside  à KADIANA avec son mari et ses 6 enfants dans une famille traditionnelle.
 Mme Kadiatou s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat - vente des habits et bijoux dès son mariage. Elle est très sollicitée au marché de Kadiana, et surtout les jours de foire. 
Fort de ses 5 années d’expériences dans le domaine, elle collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  troisième  prêt. Les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués. 
 Mme Kadiatou compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des habits (45 douzaines de de prêt à porter pour les enfants) et des bijoux (1colis). Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes à BAMAKO. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché, en famille et de façon ambulante.
Mme Kadiatou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 95.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Kadiatou was born around 1980 in Tousseguela, a sub-prefecture of the third administrative region of Mali.  She now lives in Kadiana, in a traditional family unit, with her husband and six children.

Kadiatou started working soon after her marriage, buying and selling clothes and jewellery, and has five years of experience in her business.  Her products are much sought after in the Kadiana market, particularly on fair days.  

Kadiatou works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, to improve her business and meet the ever-growing needs of her customers.  This will be her third loan with the field partner, all the previous loans have been fully repaid.  She will use her loan to buy clothes (45 dozen outfits for children) and jewellery (1 packet).  She buys her stocks from wholesalers in Bamako, and sells on a cash or credit basis, in the market, from her home or on foot.

Kadiatou hopes to earn 95,000 francs CFA per month.  She will use her earnings to provide for the needs of her family, repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and jewellery for resale.

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Haidee works hard to support her family.

Haidee has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming rice.  Haidee is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Haidee has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Viamora

texts.en:
Viamora is 37 years old and married with four children.

Viamora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Viamora has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling young coconuts.

Viamora aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Silvina works hard to support her family.

She has a banana-farming business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening. Silvina is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her banana-farming business.

Silvina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en: Hieng, 35, is married with two school-going children. He lives with his wife and children in a rural village of Samraong Tong district, Kampong Speu province. He operates a traveling business selling ice cream from his three-wheel trailer. He buys ingredients and makes ice cream by himself. As the needs of living are improving and the costs of commodities have increased, Hieng’s wife started her career as a garment worker to help Hieng cover their everyday expenses. Due to the lack of a vehicle, Hieng and wife are unable to save enough for their family because they must spend for traveling fees in commuting to work and other places. Therefore, Hieng has applied for a loan to buy a motorcycle to fulfill their transportation needs. As it is his first loan, Hieng hopes that lenders will not reject this loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to fulfill his family's transportation needs.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 69 años, esta soltera, tiene 5 hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula, con tres de sus hijos y seis nietos.  Desde hace muchos años se dedica a su propio taller de costura y confección de, ropa en general, cortinas, forros de muebles, ropa de cama etc. Este taller esta ubicado en su casa. Ella ha solicitado varios préstamos para mantener el negocio. Actualmente solicita 12,000 lempiras y lo invertirá, en la compra de materia prima como telas, hilos, retazos y utensilios como tijeras, agujas y otros y así aprovechara esta temporada navideña para confeccionar y vender mas productos. Tiene como meta mantener su negocio en pie y seguir dándole el ejemplo a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña María, age 69, is single.  She has five children and lives in the town of San Pedro Sula, with three of her children and six grandchildren.  

For many years now, she has worked in her own seamstress and dressmaking workshop, making clothing in general, curtains, furniture coverings, bed linens, etc.  Her shop is located in her home.  

She has asked for various loans to keep up her business.  Currently she is asking for 12,000 lempiras.  She will invest them in the purchase of supplies such as fabric, thread, and remnants, and tools such as scissors, needles, and others.  In this way, she will take advantage of this Christmas season to make and sell more products.  Her goal is to keep her business on its feet and to keep giving a good example to her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fabric, thread, and remnants, and tools such as scissors, needles, and others, to sew clothing

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es: El  señor  Bernardino  tiene 52 años, es casado pero su esposa esta fuera del país desde hace 8 años, está a cargo del cuidado de sus dos hijos quienes actualmente están estudiando y viven con el en la casa de sus padres.  Se dedica al servicio de transporte con una antigüedad de trece años en el sector y un año y medio en una empresa de radio taxis en calidad de propietario. Por otro lado percibe ingresos de su segundo vehículo con la renta diaria del mismo. Para mejorar sus herramientas de trabajo solicita un crédito para el mantenimiento y reparación de sus vehículos para dejarlos en buenas condiciones, continuar trabajando y seguir generando ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Bernardino, age 52, is married but for eight years his wife has been out of the country.  He has been in charge of the care of his two children, who are currently students and live with him in their parents’ home. 

He works in transportation services, with a thirteen-year career in the business, and with a year and a half in the role of owner of a radio taxi business.  He also gets income from his second vehicle by renting it out daily.  

To improve his working tools, he is asking for a loan for the maintenance and repair of his vehicles to keep them in good condition, to continue working, and to keep on generating income.

loans.use: to maintain and repair his vehicles

loans.name: Bharati

texts.en:
Bharati is a 27-year-old housewife from the small village of West Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband Sudha, 32 years, and three children (one son and two daughters). Bharati attended school up to class V (Grade 5), whereas her husband received education up to class VI (Grade 6). One of their children goes to school and he is in class II  (Grade 2).  The other two are below school-going age. The family have their own house.

Bharati's husband works as a day labourer.  His income, however, is not enough to meet the needs of his family of five members, when prices of essential goods are increasing by leaps and bounds.

Bharti herself by character is very hardworking and purposeful.  She wants to help her husband by doing some business of her own. She applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to start a new business of potato cultivation in their own piece of land. She will sell the agricultural produce (potatoes) in the local market, which will be an added source of income for her family. 

Her goals are to give their children a good education for a better future, a decent lifestyle to her family, and build a pacca house (concrete-made) .  She dreams of running her agricultural business in a sustainable way.

Bharati conveys her thanks to BJS and Kiva for helping her to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Chabibala

texts.en:
Chabibala is a sociable woman.  She is 40 years old, married and has children. She lives with her husband and children in the small village of Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri. His husband is 50 years old.   Chabibala and her husband both are uneducated and can only sign their names.  Their son is a mason and their daughter is in ninth standard (Grade 9). They have a semi-pacca  house (brick-built walls and a straw roof).

Chabibala 's husband is a cycle-van puller and earns money by carrying people and goods. Chabibala is also very hardworking and enthusiastic.  She is engaged in a business of making " Bidi"( a handmade cigarette, made by rural women and used in rural regions).  She puts in hard labour after managing her household work. By doing this she wants to earn additional income to overcome the financial hurdles of the family.  Now she thought to start a new business of cultivating potatoes in their own land, but she lacks immediate financial resources.

Chabibala learned that Kiva’s partner, BJS, gives loans to rural women to start new businesses. She has taken a loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation of potatoes.  She hopes to earn a profit as it is a lucrative business. She will sell potatoes in the local market, which will be an important source of income for the family.

Her dream is to run the agricultural business in a sustainable way. Chabibala and her family will be grateful to BJS and Kiva for their help in providing the amount they need to start the business.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Chandana

texts.en:
Chandana is only 23 years old, married, and raising their only son together with her husband. She attended school up to class VI (Grade 6). Her husband Goutam, aged only 24 years, is engaged in a small business and his income is very low. He received education up to class VII (Grade 7).  Their son is under school-going age.  They have a small kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo-made) in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Chandana also tries hard to give financial support to her family.  She has an animal husbandry business. But their income is hardly enough to run their family well.

She has decided to start a new business.  She has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to start a business of supplying milk and milk products in the locality.  She will purchase a dairy cow with the loan. She will sell milk and milk products, like curd, butter or paneer (handmade cheese) etc.  These products have a good demand in the present market.  This will generate enough of income to support her family.

With her drive and perseverance, Chandana would like to keep working hard to make her dreams into reality, such as to give better education and a better future to their only son, financial support to her family to lead a decent lifestyle, and acquire more dairy cows to make her business more profitable.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply and dairy business.

loans.name: Kimhan

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Srey Snom district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Kimhan is 24 years old and married. She  struggles to feed her two children by farming rice on two hectares of farmland. In this business for six years, Kimhan earns approximately 35,000KHR per day.

Kimhan is requesting her first microloan from VisionFund to buy pesticides, seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and sell it for a good price to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laser machine and a liposuction machine for her salon

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria lives in Maningcol, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She has a retail business that generates income to provide for her family's everyday consumption. She is hardworking, operating as a retailer in her community. Her store is located in a populous place and favorably generates good income.
 
She wants to expand her store, so she has reached out to PMPC for a loan to buy more inventory. Hilaria is very thankful for all the benefits of being a member of PMPC.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 38 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

To earn a living, Jennifer has a business selling assorted breads to members of her community. She earns about PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. Jennifer has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, butter, baking powder, sugar, baking soda, yeast, nuts, almond paste, meringue, and whipped cream. 

Jennifer has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she would like to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Hermileen

texts.en:
Hermileen is married with 1 child. She is 25 years old and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Hermileen operates a sari-sari store (general store), and she also buys and sells corn and rice to earn a living. She had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 30,000 for additional capital, which she will use to purchase five sacks each of rice and corn and to restock her retail shop with basic commodities.

Hermileen is a new member of PMPC, having joined this year (2013). In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of rice and 5 sacks of corn and to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Ronal Enrique

texts.es: El  señor Ronal tiene 42 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de su papá. Se dedica al servicio de transporte con una antigüedad de diez años en el sector y un año y medio en una empresa de radio taxis en calidad de propietario.  Por otro lado percibe ingresos de su segundo vehículo por la renta diaria del mismo. Actualmente solicita un crédito para el mantenimiento y reparación de sus vehículos para dejarlos en buenas condiciones y seguir generando ingresos para independizarse y formar una familia.
texts.en:
Ronal is a single 42-year-old man who lives at his father's home. He makes a living offering transportation services within the area using his ten-year-old car and has been owner of a radio taxi company for a year and a half. He also receives additional income from a second vehicle that he rents out daily. 

Ronal is now requesting a loan to carry out maintenance and repair on his vehicles to keep them in good condition and continue generating income to become independent and have a family.

loans.use: carry out maintenance and repair for his vehicles.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 21 years old. He lives with his parents in Kofor Qalel, a village located 3 km south of the city of Nablus. The village lies at the foot of Mount Gerizim east, rising from the sea 600 m, with a total land area of 4,700 acres. He works in carpentry, having been forced to leave school at the primary stage in order to help his father so they could increase the family's income.

Mahmoud is short on money, so he has asked Ryada for this loan to buy flagstones to pave his house. He wants to help his family with this loan to improve their house because he wants to marry soon. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to buy flagstones to pave his house

loans.name: Khosiyatmo

texts.ru: Хосиятмо трудолюбивая женщина. Она является мастером своего дела.  Хосиятмо опытная портниха и создает шедевры таджикских национальных платьев.  Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4  детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами год назад она начала свой бизнес предоставлением услуги швеи. Она предоставляет свои услуги у себя дома. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Она работает упорно, но имеет маленький доход и этот доход не хватает для обеспечения семьи, так как у нее большая семья. Хосиятмо решила организовать дополнительный бизнес скотоводством. Хосиятмо запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Khosiyatmo is a hard-working woman and good at what she does.  She is an experienced tailor and she makes Tajik national costumes that count as masterpieces.  She is married with four children at home.  With the goal of providing for her family's needs, Khosiyatmo started her sewing business one year ago.  She runs her business out of her home and thanks to her hard work, she now has a wide circle of clients.  She is a hard worker, but she doesn't make very much money and her income is not enough to take care of her large family.  Khosiyatmo decided to start a side business raising livestock.  She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy livestock.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start her new business

loans.name: Maleka

texts.en:
Maleka is a 47-year-old housewife. She is the mother of three sons. Her husband Jaynul is 55 years old and a cycle van puller by trade. Maleka passed standard V (grade 5). One of his sons is studying in class IX (grade 9). The other two sons work in a paddy rice business. They live in their own kaccha house (made of mud and straw) at the small village of Magurmari in the small town of Dhupguri.

Maleka’s husband has been pulling a cycle van for many years to supplement their family income but it does not provide them enough revenue to meet their family’s expenditures. Maleka now wishes to help her husband financially  by starting her own potato business  . She wants to grow potatoes in their own land and sell those potatoes in the local market. She has given preference to this business as potato farming is a very profitable business in the rural area. She applied for a loan and will use the loan of 12,000 INR to buy fertilizers and pesticides for farming potatoes.

She hopes the business will enable her to improve her standard of living and also that she will be able to build a pakka (concrete) house for her family in future. She is a courageous lady who never wants to lose in her life.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Annaliza works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  

Annaliza is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Annaliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 33 years old and married. She has three children.

Lilibeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from selling ornamental plants.

Lilibeth requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan.
 
Lilibeth aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ederlinda

texts.en:
Ederlinda is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Ederlinda requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business.

In the future, Ederlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income as a rice mill operator. 

Melanie is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dry goods to sell.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is 32 years old and a married woman. She is a housewife and her husband Bimal, age 40, is a greengrocer, selling different types of vegetables in the local market. They have three children; two of them are students in class II (grade 2). Another one is too small to go to school. They live in Dhupguri in a kaccha house (made of mud and straw).

The entire family depends upon Saraswati's husband’s income. Her husband struggles a lot to earn more but is unable to fulfill the basic needs of her family. Saraswati is also a hard-working woman and tries her best to support her husband.  As their income is too low, she wants to help her husband financially. She plans to grow potatoes in their own plot of land and sell them in the local market to increase their income. She needs the help from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for a loan to purchase to buy potato seeds and fertilizers. Her business profit will improve her family’s economic condition and they will be able to shift to a pakka (concrete) house. Her future dream is to purchase a cycle van with the profit from her business to carry vegetables to the market.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for farming potatoes, the most valuable agricultural crop in India.

loans.name: Nelly Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer amable y carismática, ha sido ama de casa desde que se casó y así ha vivido de manera humilde, pero feliz, pues manifiesta que no le ha faltado nada.
Hace algunos años aprendió a elaborar helados caseros de diferentes sabores y comenzó a venderlos en el barrio donde reside. La idea surgió por la necesidad de sentirse útil y además generar ingresos adicionales con los que pudiera aportar a la economía del hogar y apoyar a su esposo con estas responsabilidades.
