El crédito que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (frutas, leche, azúcar, palitos de madera, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor tener más producción, así podrá satisfacer la demanda de su producto que se incrementa en la temporada de vacaciones escolares; mejorando los ingresos que percibe y con los que podrá ahorrar para luego invertir más en su negocio, pues Nelly anhela comprar un congelador mucho más grande que le permita almacenar mayor cantidad de producto, con lo que estará en la capacidad de vender más y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nelly is a friendly and charismatic woman. She has been a housewife ever since she married. She lives a humble life but is happy and tells us that has never needed for anything.

Some years ago Nelly learned to make different flavours of home-made ice-cream and she began to sell them in her local area. The idea came from her own need to feel useful, and also because she needed to earn an income to support the household and help her husband with the financial responsibilities.

Nelly is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies (fruits milk, sugar, wooden sticks and more) in bulk. This will allow her to continue in her work, with higher production, and to satisfy the demand for her products, which increases during the school holidays. Nelly's income will increase and so she will be able to save up in order to invest more in her business. Nelly would very much like to buy a much bigger freezer so as to store her products in greater quantities. She would then be able to sell more and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies (fruits milk, sugar, wooden sticks and more) in bulk.

loans.name: Constantino

texts.es:
Constantino agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo brindado, él es una persona trabajadora que desde muy temprana edad se dedica a la agricultura  y a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y chanchos, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y chanchos. 

Constantino nació en el distrito de Paucartambo pero vive en la comunidad de Majopata anexo de la comunidad de Carnicero, él tiene 34 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de  la cual tiene tres hijos y pertenece al banco comunal “El Balcon”.

(La comunidad de Majopata está ubicada en el distrito del Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Constantino is grateful to lenders for the loan and happy for the support provided. He is a hard-working man who has worked in agriculture and small animal breeding, such as guinea pigs and pigs, since he was very young. He will use the loan to buy small animals, such as guinea pigs, hens and pigs. 

Constantino was born in the district of Paucartambo, but lives in the community of Majopata, next to the community of Carnicero. He is 34 years old and lives with her life partner, with whom he has three children. He is a member of the communal bank "El Balcón". 

(The community of Majopata is located in the district of Challabamba in the province of Paucartambo, inside the department of Cusco, Perú).

loans.use: to buy small animals, such as guinea pigs, hens and pigs.

loans.name: Adeltrodez

texts.en:
Adeltrodez owns and manages a retail store, selling assorted grocery items to make a living. She has been doing this for many years and she has been able to make a living. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used  to add capital to her business. Recently she borrowed from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery items to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to resell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marilyn has been a borrower of GDMPC for many years and it plays a big role for her living improvements. She took number of loans that she used in  improving her farm and her retail business and has successfully repaid them because she earns well.

She borrowed another loan to buy additional grocery goods to resell, for it is her desire to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Ritchie

texts.en:
Ritchie is 28 years old and lives in Tuburan, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with two children.

Ritchie sells cosmetics and earns approximately 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for additional capital to buy more products to sell.

Ritchie has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to build a store for her products.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

location.town: Pagadian-Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is widowed with four children. She is 70 years old and lives in Nailon, Tudela, Philippines.

Lydia sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, candies, snack foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

Lydia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, candies, snack foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is 58 years old. She is married and a resident of Brgy. Catagan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Starting with capitalization of 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoy the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member last April 2012 and has taken out three loans. 

Now she is applying for 10,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari (general) store, particularly basic commodities

loans.name: Mardiosa

texts.en:
Mardiosa is 49 years old. She lives in Brgy. Caniangan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Mardiosa is very responsible with her household obligations, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She is also a barangay official in her barangay (neighborhood or district). She is a widow with five children. She is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

Mardiosa wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to buy an additional three sacks of fertilizer, seeds and compost for her farm

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo runs a general store in his community to make a living. He has been doing this for many years in order to provide for his family needs. 

Marcelo joined GDMPC Micro Credit and has borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods to resell. He is hopeful to improve and expand his business to have a better source of income for his family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. Grace is married and has a pig-raising business in the Philippines.

Grace requested a 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

Grace has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Susan has been in this business for 15 years. Susan earns more income from raising livestock.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients

loans.name: Suzel

texts.en:
As a  parent of four children, Suzel works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Suzel is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell through her buy and sell fish business.

Suzel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 52 years old, married and has three children.

Elvie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fermented fish. 

Elive requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned good, spices, bread, chips, etc.

Elvie has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned good, spices, bread, chips, etc.

loans.name: Carmenchita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 12 children, Carmenchita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell sweet potato business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Carmenchita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of sweet potatoes to sell.

Carmenchita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of sweet potato to sell.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia, 37, is married and has two children who are in school.

Lucresia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for three years now,

Lucresia requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lucresia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 41 years old and married. She has five children.

Maribel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending. 

Maribel requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like laundry soap, shampoo, soft drinks, snack foods, etc. to sell.

Maribel has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. 

Maribel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like laundry soap, shampoo, soft drinks, snack foods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Noura

texts.en: Noura is 27 years old. She is a married woman who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She has worked very hard for many years to get her family ahead and give them everything they deserve. She is a nurse getting a low salary. She is trying to do everything so that her family will not need for anything. Inadequate capital and inflation mean she may not achieve her family's desires. She intends to buy some things for her house, so because her salary is not enough she applied for a loan of 180,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy furniture to use for her house. She hopes to own a car to facilitate transport to her career.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her house.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 41 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Merlinda is borrowing 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlinda has been fattening pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nila

texts.en: Nila, a 54-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are in school, has been raising and fattening pigs in the Philippines for two years. Nila is requesting her second loan from NWTF for PHP 5000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie, a 53-year-old married mother of two, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for 30 years now. The recipient of 24 past loans from NWTF, Rosemarie is requesting a new one for PHP 25000 to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additonal feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Aires

texts.en:
Aires is 27 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Aires has been pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Aires requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nemesia is 31 years old and one of her children is currently in school. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 1 year. 

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business. In the future, Nemesia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell used clothes business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 7 years now.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothes to sell. Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona is married and helps her husband work on their farm for a living. They have three children. Alona has an adult female hog, and she will sell piglets in the future. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-finance to buy feeds and vitamins for her female hog. She plans to build a shelter for her livestock in the future and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her female hog.

loans.name: Gervacio

texts.en:
From the town of Corella, Bohol, Gervacio is a 51-year-old married father of three children who are 10, 13 and 16 years old. Gervacio toils the land and grows vegetables such as eggplant, beans and ampalaya (bitter gourd). He started his business quite a years ago and is now requesting a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers. These will help Gervacio improve his farming and have a bountiful harvest.

In the future, Gervacio  hopes to expand his business and increase its profitability for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como pollos, cuyes pero también a la agricultura y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar pollos y cuyes. 

Antonia nació en el distrito de Challabamba pero vive en la comunidad de Majopata anexo de la comunidad de Carnicero, ella tiene 26 años de edad y tiene una relación  de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que pertenece al banco comunal “El Balcon”. (La comunidad de Majopata está ubicada en el distrito del Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Antonia thanks Kiva investors for the loan and is happy with the support provided.  She continues to work raising young animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs, and also works in agriculture.  On this occasion she is applying for a loan in order to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

Antonia was born in the Challabamba district but lives in the Majopata community, which is part of Carnicero.  Antonia is 26 years old and has a partner and two children.  She is hard-working and enterprising, and is part of the "El Balcon" communal bank.  (The Majopata community is in the Challabamba district of the Paucartambo province, part of the Cusco department, Peru).

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
From the town of Dauis, Bohol, Josephine is a 43-year-old married mother of four grown children. Two years ago Josephine started an enterprise raising and selling chickens and their eggs to earn a living. She is now requesting a loan to buy additional chicks and chicken feed.

In the future, Josephine hopes to expand her business, augment her income and strive for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Norly

texts.en:
Norly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell banana leaves business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase more banana leaves to sell for her buy and sell banana leaves business. Norly has been in this business for 3 years. Norly earns additional income from pig fattening.

Norly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more banana leaves to sell.

loans.name: Al

texts.en:
Al is 47 years of age and a resident of Brgy. Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with two children. He has a prawns and crabs production business from which to earn a living.  With the business, he meets many challenges, but he realizes that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Al and his wife work hard in selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their crabs and prawns. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. They have requested from Paglaum MPC a 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. Al smiles at the thought of seeing their children get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings of prawns and crabs

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is 45 years old and lives in Brgy. Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Leonila is engaged in buying and selling vegetables and spices and earns approximately 6,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to add to her capital. In the future, Leonila hopes to improve her livelihood in order for her to cater more services for her clients.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 36 years old. She is married and has three grade-school children. She lives in Northern Pob., Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. Her husband works as a private driver in a private institution, and as a responsible wife, she has engaged in beverage selling and also mineral-water refilling. She has been in this business for three years and earns a monthly income of 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos).

Marife is really striving to meet their daily needs. Marife is a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC and belongs as a member in good standing.

loans.use: To purchase five cases of beverages and capital for mineral water to sell to customers

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 60 years old, widowed, and has three children. She lives in Canibungan Proper,Tudela, Philippines. Pacita is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Pacitia is requesting a loan from PMPC, where she has been a member for eight years, which she will use to buy additional coconuts to sell. In the future, Pacita hopes to financially support her family members.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 59 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, candies, soap, groceries, etc. 

She has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane. Julieta aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, candies, soap, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime is married with 1 child. He is 48 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudela, Philippines. Jaime is a farmer and raises hogs to earn a living. He has been doing this for 10 years. He has requested a loan to buy additional piglets and sack of feeds. Jaime has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Jaime hopes to fully support his family members.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and sack of feeds

loans.name: Venchita

texts.en:
Venchita is 57 years old and she lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married, with four children. 

Venchita has a shop where she sells assorted ready-to-wear items. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan to purchase additional ready-to-wear items.

Venchita has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for three years. In the future, Venchita hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear items.

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.en:
Ciriaca is 61 years old and has seven children. Ciriaca is widowed and has one child who is still in school.

Ciriaca is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Ciriaca requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock. Ciriaca has been raising livestock for 5 years now and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Ciriaca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in San Vicente,Sinacaban, Philippines. Arlene is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Arlene is requesting a loan from PMPC, where she has been a member for one year, which she will use to buy additional feeds. In the future, Arlene hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Guia

texts.en: Guia is married with 5 children. Guia is 64 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Philippines. Guia sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy raw ingredients for snack vending. Guia has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Guia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Margie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and farming sugarcane. Margie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store business, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, chips, etc. 

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 23 years old, she lives with her husband near Nablus. The village is located west of the city of Nablus, and runs through the valley territory extending from Nablus to Tulkarem.

Yasmeen applied for a loan from Ryada to repair the closet and pay for plumbing work for the bathroom to prevent the water from leaking, this will help her to improve her house and make it better. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to repair the closet and fix leaky plumbing.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario works hard to support his family. He is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. He has been in this business for 8 years now. He requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle. In the future, Mario would like to save enough money so he could afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is married and lives in Bernad Subd, Ozamiz City, Philippines. Theresa has a restaurant to earn a living and has had this business for less than a year. She has requested a loan to buy raw materials for the expansion of her business. Theresa has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Theresa hopes to build another branch of her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 46 years old and lives in Sto. Nino Pagadian City. She is married with five children.

To earn a living, Merab has a sari-sari store and carenderia business that sells delicious food like pork adobo, pancit, kari-kari and much more.She earns about fifteen thousand pesos each month doing this type of work. Merab has requested a loan to buy goods and dry goods for her carenderia business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her carenderia

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 34 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from her general store. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Rosana is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 54 years old and married with two children. She lives in Maribojoc, Tudela, Philippines. For the past six years, she has sold goods to earn a living and she earns 4,000 PHP each month. Lorna has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

Lorna is requesting a 14,900 PHP loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, candies, junk food, beverages, detergents, soap, and other items. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, candies, junk food, beverages, detergents, soap, and other items

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Meet Martha, a farmer and a mother of 2 children, living in Ndaragwa. She has been farming for 7 years, producing and selling milk, eggs and vegetables. She loves horticultural farming the most as it yields more income to her. Her major challenge is controlling crop pests and diseases.

Martha chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they encourage small scale farmers to do agribusiness. From the training offered by Juhudi Kilimo, Martha learned how to develop a culture of saving and investing. This loan will enable her to construct a dairy unit, which will increase milk production and therefore her income will grow. This will improve the family's living standards and also give her children a better education.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 46 years old and lives in Dao-an, San Miguel. She is married with 4 children.                          

Annie sells groceries in her sari-sari business. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a of 20 thousand pesos to buy groceries for sari-sari business.                                       

Annie has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Annie hopes to have more sales markets for her sari-sari business.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her business

loans.name: Peace Center Group

texts.en:
Patricia 63 years old and lives in Balintawak, Pagadian City. She is married with 5 children.                   

Patricia has a shop that sells groceries. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 12 thousand pesos to buy groceries for her store.                                                                                

Patricia has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Patricia hopes to expand her business to the neighboring barangay.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her store

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Franco Alberto

texts.es:
Franco Alberto tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público como mototaxista, con más de 10 años de experiencia en este servicio, trasladando a sus clientes a las zonas aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando este servicio de una manera segura y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Franco Alberto is 46 years old and lives with his family in the Oyotún district, a community that works in agriculture, business and cattle raising.  Oyotún is two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, on Peru's northern coast.

Franco works as a driver of a motorbike taxi and has more than ten years of experience, transporting customers to the neighbouring areas. Franco is applying for a loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles in order to pay for maintenance on his vehicle.  He can then continue to provide safe transport services and can generate a greater income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto Carlos tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en el Caserío La Polvareda una zona rural del distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral y cerdos en la parte posterior de su domicilio, también ofrece servicio de mano agrícolas en la misma zona, Roberto ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos y alimentos balanceados para una mejor producción de los mismos, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in La Polvareda village in the Oyotún district  Here, the community works in agriculture, business and cattle raising.  Oyotún is two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, on Peru's northern coast.

Roberto makes a living raising poultry and pigs in the area behind his house.  He also works as a farm labourer in the area.  Roberto is applying for a loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles in order to buy pigs and animal feed, in order to improve production.  This will give him a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for fattening up animals.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a hardworking and responsible man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a bus driver and tries his best to provide for his family’s expenses. Ahmed’s bus is damaged and he can’t support his family. 

Ahmed is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to repair his bus and restore his daily income. This will be his second loan from AMB. Ahmed thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his bus

loans.name: Winefreda

texts.en:
Winefreda is married with 4 children. Winefreda is 60 years old and live in Poblacion, Guipos, ZDS.              

Winefreda is a farmer and grows palay crop to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 20 thousand pesos to buy agricultural supplies.                                             

Winefreda has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Winefreda hopes to harvest more palay crops.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
Doña Mayra tiene una edad de 34 años es casada y madre de 3 hijos quienes viven bajo su mismo techo y están en edad escolar en una escuela de la comunidad. Ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar su primaria completamente por lo que solo curso hasta el segundo año por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres siendo ellos de escasos recursos económicos. Ella se dedica al negocio del cultivo de café desde hace 10 años aprendiendo por vocación familiar de sus padres dicha actividad la cual fue medio de ingreso para su familia en su juventud y hoy en día lo sigue siendo. A parte de cultivar café ella también se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol en el terreno adquirido por medio de una compra que su esposo realizo hace unos años. El grano al final de la cosecha lo vende en la comunidad a compradores locales e intermediarios, vecinos y amigos que también adquieren su producto en la zona donde ella habita.
Doña Mayra como meta tiene propuesto mejorar su casa de habitación ya que necesita algunas reparaciones como repello en las paredes, remplazar algunas paredes de adobe por ladrillo el cual es más seguro y el piso. Su sueño es poder tener un gran semillero de plantilla de café para poderlo comercializar en la zona, seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios hasta que ellos puedan convertirse en profesionales. Por lo que hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual dará una mejor asistencia y un mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café ya que la temporada se aproxima y quiere sacar una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
Doña Mayra is 34 years old.  She is married and is the mother of three children who live under her roof.  They are school-aged, in the community school.  She didn’t have the opportunity to finish elementary school, and so she only finished second grade. This was due to a lack of economic support from her parents, because of their scarce economic resources.  For ten years, she has worked in the business of coffee farming, learning it from her parents as the family business.  It was the means of income for her family in her childhood, and she is still doing it today.  Besides growing coffee, she also works growing corn and beans on a plot of land she got thanks to a purchase her husband made a few years ago.  At the end of the harvest, she sells the corn and beans to local and intermediary buyers in the community, as well as neighbors and friends who also buy her produce in the area where she lives.

Doña Mayra has a goal of improving her home because it needs some repairs such as plastering the walls, replacing some adobe walls with brick, which is more secure, and the floor.  Her dream is to be able to have a great coffee plant nursery, to be able to sell in her area, to keep supporting her children in their studies until they can become professionals.  Because of this, today she is asking for a loan with which she will give better care and maintenance to her coffee plants, because the season is coming and she wants an excellent harvest.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies to help her coffee crop

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 27-year-old who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He opened a mobile phone accessories shop five years ago and has a great deal of knowledge about the market and customer demands. Jamal has found his specialty and is a man with very good communication skills who treats his customers in a very attractive and elegant way. He has special offers all the time to attract new customers and to keep his current ones. 

Jamal is requesting a 160,000 YER youth loan from AMB to add new mobile phones and special accessories to his merchandise. He will use his loan to keep up to date with new technologies. In the future, Jamal hopes to increase his income, expand his business, and improve his living standards. He dreams of a shining future.

loans.use: to add new mobile phones and special accessories to his merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy education tools.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 38 years old and married with five children. She lives in Dumagoc Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur Philippines. Vilma works selling cosmetics and she earns approximately 8,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of PMPC for five years.

Vilma is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics to sell. In the future, she hopes to buy more products to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Freshia

texts.en:
Freshia is a 29-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 8 and 13. She describes herself as loyal. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of funds and low sales. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business and pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married with 3 children. Maria is 47 years old and lives in Balongating, Guipos, ZDS in the Philippines.                                                                                                    

Maria is a farmer and grows palay crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10 thousand pesos to buy farm inputs.                                                                   

Maria has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Maria hopes to harvest more palay crops.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 47 years old, She is married and has four children. Two of them are studying and two had to stop and help to go fishing. She lives in Casul Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. 

Benita has engaged in a fishing and fish-selling business for 25 years and earns a monthly income of 6,500. Her husband is a fisherman and she is a fish vendor.

She requested a new loan to purchase another fishing net and boxes.Benita is really striving so that she could be able to repay her loan and remain a good member of Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia, a 50-year-old married woman from the town of Corella, Bohol, is the mother of seven children, her youngest 14 years of age. Emelia's husband works as a carpenter to support their family, while she runs a store that sells various items such as cooking oil, eggs, sugar, noodles, soap and canned goods.

In operation for almost one year, Emelia is requesting a loan to buy a sack of rice, soft drinks and other beverages to meet the needs of her customers. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, soft drinks and other beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband buy a collection of computer accessories to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cloth and bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr:
Madame Ngoné, évolue dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années. Elle a démarré par un étale devant la maison, en vendant surtout des légumes. Ce n’est qu’ensuite, avec l’appui d’un de ses enfants, qui lui a confectionné une cantine, qu’elle a diversifié en y ajoutant de l’huile de palme, du poisson fumé et séché. Elle appuie dans les dépenses de la maison et peut régler ses petits problèmes de régimes alimentaires grâce aux revenus de l’activité.
Ngoné veut même aller plus loin en transférant son activité dans le marché et chercher une cantine la bas, de ce fait, elle verra son bénéfice augmenter.
texts.en: Ms. Ngoné has been working in small-scale commerce for several years. She started off with a table in front of her house selling vegetables in particular. It was then only with the help of one of her children who build a stall that she was able to diversify by including palm oil, smoked fish, and dried fish. She helps to cover household expenses and can resolve various supply problems, thanks to the revenues from her business. Ngoné even wants to go further by moving her business to the market and looking for a stall down there. She will see her profits increase.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, palm oil, and other good to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and buy education equipment.

loans.name: Maria Joy

texts.en:
Maria Joy is 38 years old and married with four children. She lives in Maribojoc, Tudela,  Philippines. For the past three years, Maria Joy has been a farmer who grows corn to earn a living. She has been a member of PMPC for a month.

Maria Joy is requesting a loan to buy additional fertilizer and other chemicals used for spraying corn pests. In the future, she hopes to expand her corn plantation and to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals for spraying corn pests

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita owns a plot of farmland, where she plants bananas and coconut to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than three years and earns well for her family. She was able to repay her previous loan from GDMPC successfully. Currently, she has borrowed a new loan to cover weeding maintenance costs in order to improve the farm. Margarita wants to have an improved and better living in the future.

loans.use: to cover weeding maintenance costs.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 59 years old and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Leonida runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for one year.

Leonida is requesting a loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her general store. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith works hard to support her family. Edith is single and has a buying and selling bamboo split business in the Philippines.

Edith requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bamboo to sell.

Edith has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Edith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years. She earns additional income from her general store. 

Edna is requesting a loan from NWTF for 21,000 PHP, which she will use to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business. Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Gen

texts.en: Gen is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in Elementary Education at Mindanao University of Science and Technology in Oroquieta City. She decided to join GDMPC this year and has borrowed a new loan to pay for books for her last year in school. She wants to become a successful teacher someday.

loans.use: to pay for books.

loans.name: Maysha

texts.en: Maysha runs a general store, selling goods in their community while her husband is working as an OFW. They are a couple who are determined enough to improve their living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. With this loan, she will buy more grocery goods to resell. She plans to expand her business and hopes to have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita helps her husband working on their own farm to make a living. She has been doing this for many years and she earns well for the family. She successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used to improve their farm. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela helps her husband fishing and selling fish in town to make a living. They have been doing this for more than fifteen years. She earns well enough to provide for the family needs. Recently, she joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to buy additional materials for fishing. She is indeed hoping to have a better living with her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for fishing.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Haide works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Haide is borrowing 5,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials like nail polish, nippers, nail cutters, etc. for her manicure/pedicure service business.

Haide has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like nail polish, nippers, nail cutters, etc.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en: Taghreed was born in 1973. She is married and a mother of four. Her husband works in agriculture. Taghreed has been running her business selling detergents for the past four years. She started it in order to support her husband financially. Now she would like to expand it by buying new types of detergents that will add variety to her products. This will help her to attract more customers and increase her profit. But because she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy new types of detergents for her business

loans.name: Aleqsan

texts.en:
Aleqsan is from Vanadzor town. He is not married and lives with his parents. Aleqsan is a taxi driver with many years of experience. Aleqsan is well known among his clients as an attentive and careful driver, so people prefer to go far distances with him.
 
Currently because of some financial difficulties, Aleqsan isn't able to invest money into his car. The car that he uses as a taxi is old and needs to be repaired; therefore, Aleqsan has applied for this loan.

He is asking for the loan to be able to purchase winter tires and repair the vehicle. Aleqsan has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with less restrictive conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly help Aleqsan to continue his business, which helps him support himself and his parents.

loans.use: to pay for winter tires and repair the vehicle

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr:
La dame Rokhaya, âgée de 45 ans, est mariée et mère de deux enfants et loge derrière le guichet de IMCEC. Elle fait du commerce depuis six ans, en vendant des tissus et des ensembles pour hommes et femmes. Elle a débité avec un capital de 75000f et à développer son commerce petit à petit. Avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle s’occupe de ces enfants et de leurs besoins quotidiens.
Le développement de son activité et l’apport positif des crédits octroyés lui ont permis de réaliser un de ses vieux rêves, celui d’avoir un terrain qui lui est propre. Cela acquis, elle cherche maintenant à avoir de quoi construire.
texts.en: Ms. Rokhaya, aged 45, is a married mother of two and lives behind the IMCEC branch office. She has been doing commerce for six years selling cloth and outfits for men and women. She started off with 75,000 francs in capital to develop her business little by little. With the profits from her business, she takes care of her children and meets their day-to-day needs. The development of her business and the positive impact from the loans accorded to her enabled her to realize one of her longtime dreams, which was to have a plot of land of her own. Having achieved this, she is now seeking building material.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and outfits to resell

loans.name: Eliezer

texts.en:
Eliezer is 55 years old. He is married and has four chidren. He lives in Magsaysay Sibutad Zamboanga del Norte. 

Eliezer has engaged in a rice-farming business for 35 years and earns a monthly income of 3,500 PHP. His wife is a fruit vendor to meet their needs and to sustain their daily consumption. 

Eliezer requested a new loan to buy materials to renovate their house such as lumber and plywood. He has been a member of Paglaum since 2011.

loans.use: to buy materials for house renovation such as plywood and lumber.

loans.name: Pampille

texts.en:
Pampille, now 23 years old and single, used his previous loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell. It was profitable and he has paid the loan well and in good time. 

This being his second loan term from VisionFund Kenya, he plans to use it to buy more varieties of clothes to resell. These include shirts, t-shirts, trousers and shorts. This will enable him to meet his customers' demands as well as generate more income. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his business and buy household items for his home as well as repay the loan. 

In the future, he hopes to become a successful businessman and thereby improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make a fence around his farm.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer offers cosmetic products, shoes and pants for sale within her local community. She is 42 years old, married and has two children. Aside from being a community health worker, she operates a direct selling business of Avon products' personal collection for added income. Her spouse is a farmer. 

Jennifer would like to borrow a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy more Avon products such as cologne, perfume, powder, clothes and shoes to sell. She hopes to get the loan amount she requested to gain customers' loyalty and satisfy their needs. Jennifer is looking forward to approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy more Avon products such as cologne, perfume, powder, clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina’s family lives peacefully at Solana. She is 56 years old and widowed. To sustain her family, she raises hogs to sell upon achieving the desired weight. 

Nina would like to keep improving her small business but it requires additional capital and that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy feed and vaccines for sustainability. She hopes to become a successful hog grower and save more income, too.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for sustainability of her pigs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 55-year-old woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 20 years to 26 years. She describes herself as determined and honest. 

She operates a boutique where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of funds.
 
She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be well established within five years. She hopes that in the future, she can create employment. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 51-year-old lady, who lives with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to save so that she can provide better living facilities to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Razia's son has been driving a motor rickshaw for several years. However, his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw’s body, but he does not have sufficient funds to fix the problem. Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her son can buy a motor rickshaw body. She hopes that she will be able to save enough until the time when her son marries.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the motor rickshaw body.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran, age of 41, is the mother of two daughters and three sons, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a very hardworker and a gracious and honest person. Her husband owns a small restaurant in which he offers types of delicious foods two times in a day. He has been running this restaurant for many years, generating a good profit from the restaurant business. Sughran helps her husband by cooking various foods at home which her husband sells from his restaurant. He offers tea to his customers also. Now he wants to establish his restaurant by purchasing new utensils, a cauldron, spoons and crockery, etc. Due to household expenses, his savings are not enough to buy desired things. Therefore, Sughran requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy utensils, a cauldron, crockery and spoons, etc. She thanks Kiva and appreciates the warm support of her.

loans.use: to buy utensils, crockery, and food items for the restaurant.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a young and kindly 27-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a very hardworking man and loves his family very much. He is involved in his own business to have a regular income in the family. He is involved in manufacturing and selling wooden furniture, such as single beds, tables, etc. He started this business over fifteen years ago. 

Naseem's husband previously obtained loans for his business, he added two previous loans to his selection of making furniture. Today, he has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs are increasing day by day and he needs to earn more money. Now he wants to buy more raw materials for making furniture in order to cope with the increasing demand and to fulfill the needs of his family through generated income.

Therefore, Naseem came to BRAC Pakistan wishing to obtain a loan to buy raw materials for making furniture. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: To buy timber, planks, and chipboard for furniture workshop.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Meet 57 year old Veronica, who is an established farmer in Ndaragwa. She is married and has 9 children. She has practiced farming for the past 20 years. She mostly produces and sells milk and eggs. Her difficult times are when she experiences drought seasons because there is not enough produce on her farm.

Veronica chose Juhudi Kilimo because she has seen other farmers benefit from it. She appreciates the fact that they process their loans in the shortest time possible. During the training offered by the loan officers, she learned how to develop a lifestyle of savings. This loan will enable her to venture into sheep farming and this will bring in more income so that she and her large family will have better lives.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem belongs to a poor family, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a blacksmith. He manufactures iron accessories such as doors and windows which are usable in houses. He has also been providing door-to-door services to weld broken iron accessories. A few days ago, his welding plant became out of order due to overheating and needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy a new welding plant, but does not have enough cash in hand due to excess household expenses. Therefore, Naseem requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, who is an active field partner of Kiva, so her husband will be able to buy a welding plant to continue manufacturing.

loans.use: to buy a welding plant to weld iron accessories.

loans.name: Lina Yancely

texts.es:
Lina es una mujer activa y emprendedora que ha buscado la manera de ganarse la vida con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Trabajó durante 4 años como operaria de un taller de confección donde aprendió el oficio y obtuvo experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de negocios pero, con el ánimo de generar mejores ingresos, decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio en el que manda a cortar y confeccionar las prendas y ella realiza la terminación con pedrería y accesorios y luego las vende; trabaja sola de lunes a sábado y ha logrado adquirir muy buena clientela, lo que le permite generar los ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Su propósito con el crédito es comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, pedrería, cintas, entre otros), así podrá aumentar su producción y vender más artículos, obteniendo mejores ingresos. 
Lina, a sus 25 años de edad, tiene como meta confeccionar su línea propia y tener su propio almacén para así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio y poder disfrutar mejores condiciones de vida en compañía de su esposo.
texts.en:
Lina is an active and enterprising woman who has searched for a way to earn her living with much effort and dedication. She worked for four years as an operator in a sewing workshop. She learned the work and gained the experience needed to run this type of business. With the desire to make more money she decided to become independent and open her own business where she cuts and sews garments. She finishes them with stones and accessories and then sells them. She works by herself from Monday to Saturday and has managed to gain a good clientele. This generates enough money to help her husband with the household finances. 

The purpose of this loan is to buy supplies wholesale (fabric, thread, buttons, semi precious stones, ribbons, etc.). Then she can increase her production, sell more garments and increase her income. Lina at 25 years old, has the goal of making her own line of clothing and having her own store to improve the profitability of her business and enjoy better living conditions with her husband.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (fabric, thread, buttons, semi precious stones, ribbons, etc.)

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es:
La socia perteneces al banco comunal SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Coya en la provincia  de Calca departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maximiliana; la socia tiene 51 años de edad, 3 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesania, la socia vende y elabora diferentes tipos de artesanía como pulseras hechos con hilo de colores, mantos, textiles entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales como hilos de colores entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de crianza de animales, compra y venta de productos (cereales) venta de chicha, venta de granos secos, venta de verduras, artesanía.
La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
The member is a part of the San Antonio de Padua communal bank.  This bank is located in the district of Coya, in the Calca province in the administrative region of Cusco. 

Maximilian is 51 years old, she is married and has three children.  In addition to her daily activities, she also has a business selling handicrafts.  She makes and sells different types of crafts such a woven bracelets, sheets, and textiles among other things.  She has dedicated herself to this business for a long time, and she has been successful thanks to the effort he puts forth everyday.  The member hopes to continue working in this business so she can continue to support her family.  

She is seeking this loan to purchase materials such as colored thread.

The other members work raising animals, buying and selling products, selling chichi (corn beer), selling dry grains, selling vegetables, and selling handicrafts.  The member is grateful for this opportunity to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: purchase materials such as colored thread.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 55 years old and married, with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like biscuits, soap, eggs, milk, sugar, and noodles.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income as a rice retailer.

Evelyn aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family and to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like biscuits, soap, eggs, milk, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 53-year-old married woman. She has six children. She describes herself as a committed person. 

She operates a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in an area of good potential and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to add stock of cereals. Her business goal is to open a restaurant within five years. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to add stock of cereals.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 25-year-old married woman. She has one child who is 3 years old. She describes herself as a God-fearing and determined person. 

She operates an M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. Her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as network failure and competition. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add M-pesa float, i.e., money, for customers to withdraw. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and sustain her family. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float (money) for customers to withdraw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fence his farm.

loans.name: Judylin

texts.en:
Judylin works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Judylin requested a PHP 26,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items to sell, like soap, canned goods, chips, and eggs.

Judylin has been in this business for 18 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like soap, canned goods, chips, and eggs.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a single woman, 45 years old, and she works hard to help her parents to generate additional income for the family.

Remedios has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, soft drinks, eggs, milk, coffee, and bread.

Remedios has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, soft drinks, eggs, milk, coffee, and bread.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Alma requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients, like beans, sugar, ground ice, milk, and fruit.

Alma has been in this business for ten years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, like beans, sugar, ground ice, milk, and fruit.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Josephine is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, like meat, vegetables, and spices.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, like meat, vegetables, and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 31 years old, single and has a five-year-old son whom he supports. He sells leather products such as handbags, wallets, wall portraits and pictures. He has been in this business for seven years now and it has been profitable. 

He plans to use this loan to buy leather materials for making bags and wallets and other leather products. He will use the generated profits to improve his business by buying more leather materials and beads for making more products to sell.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes and dreams are to open a big shop for selling leather products to other areas of the country.

loans.use: to buy leather materials for making handbags.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred runs a tailoring business in Kangundo town and has been in the business for 1 year now. She is 28 years old, single and has one child. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more sewing materials, threads, buttons and ribbons for use in her business. She will use the generated profits from the business to expand her business by buying more materials. She will also save some of the income as well as repay the loan. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to be successful in her tailoring business, make more income and be able to educate her child as well as provide for his basic needs such as food, shelter and clothing.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and threads.

loans.name: Maria Catherine

texts.en:
Maria Catherine is a 24-year-old woman from the town of Baclayaon, Bohol. She is married with a four-year-old child. She runs a sari-sari store. She sells various items like candies, biscuits, soap, seasonings and canned goods. Aside from running a store, she engages in a dried fish vending business to have an additional source of income. She started this business less than a year ago. She is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish like bolinao (stinky fish) to maintain the inventory of her store.

In the future, Maria Catherine hopes to expand her business and increase its profitability for her child's welfare and also to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish like bolinao (stinky fish).

loans.name: Aivaz

texts.en: Aivaz is a 23-year-old young man, who lives in Marneuli district. He has a mother and a married brother as his family. His mother and sister-in-law are housekeepers and take care of a child. Aivaz's brother is working at a fast food business and generates 500-600 GEL monthly. This is the only source of the family's income and they find it hard to pay for all the family's daily costs. Because of this, Aivaz decided to start his own activity and requested a loan. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Aivaz applied for credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved as part of a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.  A loan of $1500 will help Aivaz to purchase a secondhand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them inter-city. Aivaz is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure his family has good education for progressing in life. This credit will be a great support for the family. Aivaz is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is 21 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his family of 5 siblings and parents. 

Yousef started supporting himself when he was 18 years old. He has worked at offices and a school supplies shop. He now works at a supermarket and also studies for his Bachelors’ degree in Accounting. He is in his 2nd year and plans to find a job in his field of study after graduation.  He hopes to financially support his family.   They are facing a financial crisis and can not  pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to help pay college fees.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 59-year-old widow with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elizabeth is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Elizabeth has been raising pigs for 5 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to repair and renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Song's Group

texts.en:
Song, 52, is from a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 52 years old and married with seven children. To make a living, Song has been farming rice and sometimes she works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about 32,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Song has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan which helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion of the loan to pay for harvesting rice. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice

loans.name: Sophong's Group

texts.en:
Sophong, a 20-year-old mother of one daughter, lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She and her husband earn a living by  growing rice and working for others for a fee. She earns about 28,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second micro-loan for Sophong with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, Sophong is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting rice. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income to make a living better.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice.

loans.name: Shikuku

texts.en:
Shikuku is a 29-year-old married man. He has one child who is 10 years old. He describes himself as an ambitious person. 

He operates a tailoring shop where he makes dresses for sale. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a conducive environment and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to add fabric, threads and other materials for making dresses. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. 

This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to pay the loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads and other materials for making dresses.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son todos independientes, vive en una casa en anticretico ocupando cuatro habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Cota cota de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe una renta de jubilación con lo cual debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos,  es por la misma razón que solicita el crédito ya que desea aumentar su capital para el comercio de ropa para mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Maria es tener su casa propia ya que actualmente vive sola y no percibe ninguna clase de  ayuda por parte de sus hijos es por eso que le resulta muy complicado el trasladarse.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Maria is divorced and has three children who are all already independent. She lives in a house under an antichresis rental arrangement, occupying four rooms. The house is located in the Cota Cota area of the city of La Paz.

Currently, she receives a retirement pension, with which she should be able to cover the cost of food and basic services. This is the same reason she is asking for the loan, since she wants to increase her capital for the clothing business in order to improve her income.

Maria's dream is to have her own house, since currently she lives alone and does not receive any kind of help from her children. That is why it is very complicated for her to move.

This is the third time she has worked with IMPRO and the second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of clothing to increase her business selling it.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria. She previously received a loan for PHP 45,000 that she used to buy additional merchandise like jacket sand shirts to sell to her customers. Her earnings were a big help in meeting her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional merchandise because the more items she displays at in her store the higher her profits will be. She will use the money she earns to meet her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this new loan with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Maria dreams of having her own factory so she can make her own products and better support her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise like jackets, shirts and other products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fursa Group

texts.en:
PILLY, who is in her mid 40s, is married with two children, both of whom are still going to school.  She has been selling clothes for five years now.  She works from 8 AM-8 PM daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be PILLY's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy different types of clothes. She has paid back her loan successfully.  She is doing great and appreciates the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees, cover household expenses and she is saving money in order to buy a tricycle (bajaji).  She will use this money to buy clothes to resell. She dreams of opening another clothing shop in a different area.

Pilly will share this loan with her loan group "FURSA," which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 36 years old, married to Serah, and together they are blessed with four children, aged between seven to 15 years old.

Philip is a milk vendor and he has been in this business for four years. He also practices dairy farming. He has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him buy a motorbike which he will use to deliver the dairy products to his customers. With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business and also pay for school fees.
 
In the near future, Philip hopes to apply for bigger loans from VisionFund Kenya to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for delivering dairy products to customers

loans.name: Mkombozi Group

texts.en:
Nara, who is in his early thirties, is married and has two boys who are enrolled to school. For six years now, Nara has been in the motorcycle repair business. He works from 7 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly income.  

This will be Nara's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a motorcycle and spare parts for repair of more motorcycles. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy work equipment. He dreams of opening a workshop for motorcycle spare parts.

Nara will share this loan with his loan group "MKOMBOZI." The two members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy work equipment.

loans.name: Nadupoi

texts.en:
Nadupoi is a divorced lady, aged 35. She is a mother of five children, aged 18, 15, 13, 7, and 4 years old. She trades charcoal in Narok and has been running the business for two years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).
