She learned about VisionFund Kenya from one of her regular customers. She has borrowed a first loan loan of 10,000 KES, which she intends to use to pay for the transportation of bags of charcoal to her premises. 

The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children. Her dream is to improve her family's living standards and expand to a general retail shop.

loans.use: to pay for charcoal transport

loans.name: Asernal Group

texts.en:
Winifrida, who is in her late 30s is married with two children a boy and a daughter who are still going to school.  She has been running a cafe business selling soft drinks and food service: breakfast, lunch and supper. She works from 07am to 10pm per working day and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Winifrida used the previous loans all of which have been paid back successfully to buy food cooking supplies like rice, banana, baking flour, cooking oil and other items related. She also bought stock of soft drinks for her business so as to service more customers.  Winifrida's business profit, she used to cover school fees,family food expenses and covered on her building expenses. She will use this loan to buy soda, water, juices and cooking food supplies for her cafe business. She dreams of being able to improve more her cafe so as to offer good food services. 

Winifrida will share this loan with her loan group " Asernal " which consist of twelve members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy soda,water, juices and cooking food supplies for her cafe business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 55, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio and a mother to their children. Together with husband, she manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lolita operates a feather duster business. She makes feather dusters and sell them for retail to households. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more raw materials like thread, needles, bamboo and feathers.

Lolita hopes to expand her business and have more customers. She dreams to have a better means of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials such as thread, needles, bamboo and feathers for her business.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en: Marisa helps her husband working on their own farm for a living. For more than three years, she has been able to provide for the needs of the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used to buy fertilizer. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to buy organic fertilizer and pay for maintenance costs. She plans to plant another variety of seedlings to expand her garden in order to generate additional income.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pay for maintenance costs.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married woman. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her family challenge to be the lack of enough water storage facilities. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit 8 family members. 

She hopes that in the future, she will economically sustain her family. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is 49 years old and has seven children. She is married and has two children who are still in school.

Bienvenida is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Bienvenida has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Bienvenida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en:
Emmalyn works hard to support her family. She is single and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

Emmalyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Emmalyn has been in this business for six years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 34 years old and married, with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emma has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Emma aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old and married with three children.

Erlinda  works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more soap, shampoo, chips, eggs, canned goods, and other items to sell. 

She has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more soap, shampoo, chips, eggs, canned goods, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a mobile business selling dried fish in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a 16000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

She has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Korn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Moung Russey district where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Korn is a 35-year-old mother of five children.

She has farmed rice and worked for others for a fee for five years. The current business earns her about 26,000 KHR per day. 
Korn has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She is applying for a new loan. Korn, who is the leader, will use her portion to harvest rice. She hopes to earn additional income from her paddy and buy more farmland.

loans.use: to harvest rice.

loans.name: Choern

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Cheuny Prey district, Kampong Cham province, Choern is a 59-year-old widow. She has two children. 

Choern earns a living raising pigs and working for others for a fee. She earns about 38,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Choern has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She requests a loan to buy more piglets and pig feed. She hopes to make more income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more piglets.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami is 23 years old. He lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his family of 3 siblings and parents. He is studying for a Bachelors’ degree in Accounting and is in his 4th year.  Rami is close to graduating and plans to find a job in his field of study.  He wants to financially support his family because they are facing a financial crisis can not pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district, Chanthy is 32 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by growing cabbage and raise ducks. She has been in this business for six years and earns about 60,000 KHR per day.
 
This is Chanthy's fourth micro-loan with Kiva’s partner and she repaid the past loans. She is applying for a new a loan to buy more ducks to raise and use a portion of the loan to buy seeds for her plantation. She hopes to grown more crops and  fatten her ducks to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy more ducks to raise.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Yeam

texts.en:
Aged 48 years old, Yeam is a married mother of four children living in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Rice farming and duck raising are the main sources of the family’s income. Having been in this business for 25 years, she can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Yeam has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She completely repaid the past loan, which has enabled her to better support her family and have some money. 

Now she is requesting a loan. Yeam is going to buy duck feed, and use a portion of it to spend harvesting rice. 

With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice healthfully and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to spend harvesting rice

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and renovate his farm.

loans.name: Loun's Group

texts.en:
Loun is aged 56 and widowed. She lives in a rural area in Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer who grows rice on six hectares of farmland. Sometimes, she works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 47,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the fifth loan for Loun with VisionFund. She completely paid back her past loan which has helped her better support her family’s needs. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion of the loan to pay for harvesting rice. She hopes to grow more crops so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice

loans.name: Shorouq

texts.en:
Shourouq is a 21-year-old lady who lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her husband and two children. She is studying for her Bachelor's majoring in Information and Office Management. She is in her third year. 

Shorouq is planning to work in her study field after graduation to start helping her husband financially as he is currently facing a financial crisis which is not allowing him to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Thavry

texts.en:
Thavry is 23 years old. She is married and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of USD 3 daily. 

Due to lack of funds, Thavry is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase timber, to build her house. This money will help her obtain a convenient house for her family’s living. 

In the future, Thavry would like to run her own tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase timber, to build her house.

loans.name: Gulbonu

texts.ru: Гулбону замужняя женщина в возрасте 51 года. Она проживает с мужем и двумя сыновьями в городе Душанбе. Ее старшая дочь замужем и живет с ними по соседству. Гулбону по профессии портниха и зарабатывает этим на жизнь. Она шьет в основном женские национальные платья. Она открыла свой швейный бизнес не так давно. Скоро будет два года как она занимается шитьем. Оба сыновей Гулбону являются студентами. Младший сын Гулбону 21-летний Рабани учится в экономическом факультете Российско-Таджикского Славянского Университета. В будущем он хочет стать хорошим специалистом. В этом году его семья не смогла оплатить за его учебу, так как в их семье два студента и у родителей не хватило финансовых средств на его учебу. Мать хочет помочь сыну и поэтому берет кредит. Она собирается оплатить за этот учебный год, чтобы его сын продолжил учебу в университете. У самой Гулбону нет высшего образования, но она очень хочет, чтобы ее сыновья успешно окончили ВУЗ и получив диплом о высшем образовании работали по своим специальностям.
texts.en: Gulbonu is a married, 51 year-old woman.  She lives with her husband and two sons in the city of Dushanbe.  Her oldest daughter is married and lives near them.  Gulbonu is a seamstress and earns a living with this trade.  She primarily sews women's national dresses.  She opened her own sewing business not long ago.  It will soon be two years since she has gotten involved in sewing.  Both of Gulbonu's sons are students.  Her youngest, 21 year-old son, Rabani, is studying economics at the Russian-Tajik Slavic University.  In the future, he wants to become a good specialist.  This year, his family could not pay for his education because the family has two students, and the parents did not have enough money to pay for his studies.  The mother wants to help her son and is requesting a loan for this purpose.  She plans to pay for this school year, so that her son could continue studying at the university.  Gulbonu does not have a higher education, but she wants very much for her sons to finish universities and worked in their fields after obtaining their higher education diplomas.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university education

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: As the married parent of four children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by farming rice. She is requesting a loan for PHP 22,000 from NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, eggs, soap, bread, coffee, etc to sell in her store. Jocelyn has sustained her business activities with help from five previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as shampoo, eggs, soap, bread, coffee, etc

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is 33 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional items such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits, bread, cooking oil, etc. to sell. Angela has taken out and repaid seven prior loans from NWTF, has been running her general store for eight years and also earns income by buying and selling native mats. Her goal is to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits, bread and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks, such as soap, egg, mik, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 30 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks, such as soap, egg, mik, sugar, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice and corn business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice and corn to sell for her buy and sell rice and corn business.

Arsenia has been in this business for 19 years. Arsenia earns more income from buying and selling livestock.

Arsenia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice and corn to sell

loans.name: Mercaditos De Patria Group

texts.es:
La socia Teresa pertenece al banco comunal “Mercaditos de Patria” en el poblado de Patria.  
La socia Teresa, continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de pollipapas y salchipapas, la socia vende a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia. 
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, papas, entre otros para su negocio.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura, venta de madera, venta de ropa, venta de comida, a la crianza de animales menores, a la construcción de casas y otras cosas más. 
La socia y el grupo se sienten agradecidos  por el crédito otorgado y  se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Teresa belongs to the "Mercaditos de Patria" ("Little Markets of Patria") communal bank in the village of Patria.

Teresa continues with her business selling pollipapas and salchipapas [chicken or sausage with potatoes]. She sells to her customers who ask her for them. She has had this business for a quite awhile, and it is going well for her thanks to the determination she brings every day to her business. She wants to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way.

She is asking for the loan to buy supplies such as oil and potatoes, among others, for her business.

The other members work in agriculture, selling wood, selling clothing, selling food, raising small animals, building houses, and other things.

She and the group are grateful for the loan given, and they promise to make their various loan repayments within the established time periods.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as oil and potatoes, among others, for her business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina tiene 2 negocios desde hace 10 años, un centro de llamadas nacionales e internacionales y tambien vende minutos a celulares y recargas; ademas de este negocio, comercializa productos, mediante guias especializadas o catalogos, la cual fue su primera actividad generadora de ingresos; con estos dos negocios, ha logrado sostener su hogar y satisfacer la necesidades de su hija, en la edad e 18 años, quien esta a punto de terminar su nivel de bachillerato y seguir una carrera universitaria, con la cual sueña;  este es justamente el mayor desafio para Josefina, por el cual se esmera dia a dia. En su negocio vende a crédito y de contado trabajando  desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 8 de la noche, en una frecuencia diaria; cuando llegan las temporadas de alto volumen de ventas, el retorno de su inversión no es suficiente, para comprar articulos demandados por su clientela y ofrecer nuevos servicios a esta,  razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos de tocador, y un dispositivo, para hacer llamadas internacionales a un menor costo y con  mayor efectividad. En su desafio de ser mujer cabeza de familia, dia a dia, se levanta dispuesta a trabajar e impulsada por la necesidad de  conseguir los recursos suficientes para sostener su hogar, invertir y ganar mucho mas, para poco a poco lograr su bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Josefina has had two business for the past 10 years. One is a center for national and international telephone calls where she also sells cellular phone minutes and provides phone charging services. In addition to this business, she also sells products through specialized guides or catalogs. This was her first income-generating business. With these two businesses, she has been able to sustain her household and provide for her daughter, who is 18 years old. Her daughter is almost finished with high school and she will continue on to college. This is Josefina's main challenge, which she fights for every day.

She makes her sales in a cash and credit. She works from 8 am to 8 pm every day. When the times of high volumes of sales arrive, the return on her investment is not sufficient. She needs to purchase items that her customers demand and offer new services to them, so she has turned to a Kiva loan. This is the first loan that she has received through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (Mario Santo Domingo Foundation).

With this loan, she will purchase toiletries and a device to make international phone calls at a lower cost and with better quality.

As the female head of her household, she wakes up every day ready to work and motivated by the need to earn enough money to support her family, invest, and earn more, so that she can improve her family's well-being little by little.

loans.use: to purchase toiletries and a device to make international phone calls.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia operates a small variety store for income. She is selling biscuits, noodles, canned goods, and soap. She has been in her business for two years.

Emilia is 48 years old, and had two children.

Emilia is now asking for additional capital of PHP 6,000 to invest in her business. She will buy more noodles, canned goods, milk, and sugar to sell.

She hopes to keep extending good products and services to her customers so she could earn more profits for her family’s future expenses.

loans.use: to buy more noodles, canned goods, milk, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Glynn

texts.en:
Glynn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of direct selling Avon products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more Avon products to sell to her customers for her direct selling Avon products business.

Glynn has been in this business for three years. Glynn earns more income from a general store.

Glynn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more Avon products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is a 46-year-old married man, who lives in village Akhalisopeli, Khelvachauri district. He lives with his wife, daughter and mother, who get monthly assistance from the local government. The family has income from agricultural activities, in particular they have milk cows, produce milk products, and sell them at the local market. Ramaz always has high quality products and has his own constant clients. He has also cultivated mandarin and sells it seasonally. 

Ramaz is really hard-working man with great desire to improve his family's living conditions and make a better future for his daughter. He has not amassed enough money to start another stable activity, so he requested a loan from MFO Credo, with the startup program that enables people to start or re-start businesses. 

A loan of $3000 will help him to purchase a second-hand car and start a taxi business. It will be a huge support for the family, as they will not depend on seasonal income and can pay all daily costs. Ramaz awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start taxi business

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet lives in Vanadzor with his mother, wife and two school-age children. Hamlet has been involved in construction for 5 years. He renovates roofs, doors and provides other home construction services. Hamlet provides high quality work and has a good client list. He requests a loan to purchase a car  for his work. Hamlet has saved some money but it is not enough to purchase a car, so he decided to apply for this loan. 

Hamlet has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Hamlet will be very grateful to all lenders for their support as this loan is very important for him.

loans.use: to pay for a car

loans.name: Nigar

texts.en:
Nigar is married with two children. She started to make wedding and baby candies (candies that are given at wedding ceremonies and when a baby is born) by herself. She showed her work to a couple of companies and they liked it. Later, a company asked her to work with them. The company would give her a list of orders, she would make the candies and then she would deliver them to the company. Working this way was good for her. She could spend time with her family and do the housework. She worked with this company for a long time. The company paid her half the amount for her labor on her last order, so she got sad and angry. That day, she delivered the orders and she decided to do this work on her own while she was on her way home.

 As soon as she got home, she told her husband: "Take me to Istanbul. I will buy materials and do this work by myself." Her husband was shocked and thought she was saying these things because she was angry. But Nigar had made a decision. She insisted, and they went to Istanbul that day. They bought the necessary materials and started to work immediately. She does not have difficulty selling the products because her network is very good. She has been working for five years and earning money this way. She is going to buy varieties of baubles, tulle, lavender, ribbons and chains with the loan. She has two orders for baby candies, and she is going to deliver them. She aims to open her own shop, even if it will be small, hire two employees and teach her job to them. One of her children finished university and got married. She wants her younger child to go to university, and she wants to support him. She hopes to grow her business and keep going forward.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Nigar Hanım evli ve 2 çocuk annesi.  Evde kendini geliştirerek nikah ve bebek şekerleri yapmaya başlamış.  Bir kaç yere gösterdi ve beğenildi.  Daha sonra bir firma , beraber çalışmayı teklif etti.  Firma iş veriyordu ,nikah şekerlerini süslüyordu daha sonra teslim ediyordu.  Böyle çalışmak iyiydi evine ,çocuklarına vakit ayırıyor ve işlerini yapıyordu.  Uzun zaman bu firma ile çalıştı.  Son işinde maddi olarak emeğinin karşılığının yarısını verince çok üzüldü ve kızdı.  O gün siparişleri teslim etti ve eve giderken bu işi artık kendi yapmaya karar verdi.  Eve gider gitmez eşine beni  İstanbul’a götür kendime malzeme alıp artık kendim çalışıcam demiş.  Eşi çok şaşırmış ve kızgınlıkla söylediğini vazgeçeceğini düşünmüş.  Nigar Hanım, kararını vermişti ve ısrarların üzerine o gün akşama doğru İstanbul’a gitmişler.  Nikah ve bebek şekerleri için  malzeme alıp hemen çalışmaya başlamış.  Çevresi çok olduğundan iş anlamında bir sıkıntı yaşamamış.  Beş yıldır kendi  yapıp satıyor ve gelir elde ediyor.  Aldığı kredi ile çeşitli biblolar ,tüller,zincir ,Lavanta,şeker ,kurdelalar alacak.  İki tane bebek şekeri siparişi var onları yapıp teslim edecek.  Nigar Hanım, ileride küçük de olsa bir dükkan açmayı ,yanına bir iki eleman alıp hem istihdam sağlamak hem de işi öğretmek istiyor.  Bir çocuğu ünüversiteyi bitirip işe girdi evlendi.  Küçük oğlunu da okutmak istiyor.  İşimde büyümek ve ilerlemek istiyor.

loans.use: buy different varieties of baubles, tulle, lavender, ribbons and chains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Aneta

texts.en:
Aneta works hard to satisfy her clients' needs and provide high quality service. As the only breadwinner of her small family, Aneta feels responsible to provide her son with appropriate living conditions. She is now asking for this loan to be able to purchase food products for her cafe. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Aneta will be very grateful for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for food products for her cafe

loans.name: Baraa

texts.en: Baraa is 20 years old and living with her parents and five younger siblings in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq. Her mother works in the ministry of education. Baraa is studying for her Bachelor's, majoring in Psychological Guidance. She is in her third year. She is planning to start her work life after graduation to support her family financially. To do so, she needs to pay her upcoming semester tuition, but she doesn't have enough money. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is from the village of Alvani. He is 40-years-old and lives with his wife. The family has only a seasonal income from agricultural activities. They have a piece of land where maize is grown. The harvests are sold locally.

Levan and his wife live in poverty and it’s often difficult for the family to cover feeding costs, that is the reason why Levan decided to purchase two milk cows and start a dairy business.  Levan's wife will produce cheese for selling as well as for family consumption. This loan will be a great support for Levan’s family, as it will generate income. Levan hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy milk cows and start a dairy business

loans.name: Dorimaine

texts.fr: Dorimaine est une jeune dame âgé de 30 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants donc le plus âgé à 14 le dernier est de 4 ans. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis des années,  mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des tissus et le petit matériel de coutures (épingles, aiguilles, doublure, fil...) qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, elle pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dorimaine is a young woman, 30 years of age, married, and the mother of four children between the ages of four and fourteen years old. She has a sewing workshop, and has been having difficulties keeping her customers satisfied due to a lack of supplies (fabrics).

With this in mind, she is requesting a loan to buy fabrics and small equipment (pins, needles, lining, thread) to avoid going to the market all the time and so she can sew and sell her services to customers. With the loan that we will provide her, Dorimaine plans to enlarge her workshop so that she can increase her merchandise turnover and take good care of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and small equipment (pins, needles, lining, thread)

loans.name: Tol

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Cheung Prey district, Tol is 47 years old and widowed. She has four children. To make a living, Tol has been selling grocery items for 24 years. She is able to earn about 40,000 KHR. 

This is the microloan for Tol and she is a first cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan. 

She is going to buy more grocery items to sell. 

She hopes to earn more income to fulfill her dream of having a proper motorbike to use with her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti runs a small stall which sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Siti lives in Cibubur, a semi-urban area about 1.5 hours from Jakarta.  Siti is married. 

Siti began working with Ruma one year ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last three months she has had around $53 – 54 per day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to obtain working capital needed to process transactions on the weekend

loans.name: Rody Merlin Or

texts.fr: Merlin est un homme de 35 ans, il vie en concubinage et est père de deux enfants parmi lesquels un va déjà à l'école. Il est commerçant et détient une alimentation au cœur d'un marché de la capitale depuis 9 mois déjà. son activité se déroule bien car il arrive à réaliser un chiffre d'affaire considérable par mois. Cependant, il est très souvent confronté au problème de rupture de stock car il est obligé d'écouler la totalité de sa marchandise afin de pouvoir se réapprovisionner. C'est pour faire face à ce problème qu'il sollicite ce crédit. ce crédit lui permettra d'acheter des produits alimentaires( riz, savon, huile, boîtes de conserve). Les bénéfices qu'il réalisera grâce à ce crédit seront par la suite réinvestis dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste servira pour les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Merlin is a 35-year-old man, who lives with his partner and is a father to two children, one of whom is already at school. He is a retailer, and has run a food store in a market in the capital for 9 months. His business is doing well, and he has considerable income each month. Nevertheless, he often has to face the problem of stock shortages, as he has to sell all of his products before he can re-stock. 

Due to this problem, Merlin has requested a loan. This loan will allow him to buy products (rice, soap, oil, canned goods). With the profits he makes thanks to this loan, he will be able to reinvest in expanding his business, as well as providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy products (rice, soap, oil, canned goods) to sell

loans.name: Marceline

texts.fr: Marceline est une femme de 35 ans mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont l'âge vari entre 13 et 3 ans. Parmi ses enfants, trois vont encore à l'école. Elle détient un atelier de moulin à écraser dans un quartier de la cité capital depuis six mois déjà. Dans son quartier, Marceline est la seule à exercer cette activité qui se déroule dans de très bonnes conditions. Cependant, la demande de sa clientèle ne cesse de s'accroitre de jour en jour vu qu'elle est la seule à exercer cette activité dans son quartier. Pour résoudre ce problème, elle sollicite un crédit afin d'acquérir une nouvelle machine à écraser. ceci lui permettra de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et d'augmenter ses bénéfices. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour agrandir son activité d'une part et le reste servira à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marceline is a 35-year-old woman, married, with four children between the ages of three and 13 years old. Three of her children are currently attending school. She has been running a shop with milling machines in a district of the capital city for the past six months.

In her neighborhood, Marceline is the only mill who runs her business under very good conditions. Due to this, her customer demand continues to increase daily as she is the only mill in her district. To help alleviate this problem, she is requesting a loan to buy a new milling machine. This will allow her to better serve customers. Marceline plans to save her earnings so that she can expand her business, as well as provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a milling machine.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne est d'une femme âgé de 55 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants dont l'âge vari entre 34 et 25 ans parmi ses enfants un est scolarisé. elle as 3 petit fils, maman Jeanne fait dans la vente des boissons mais depuis un certain temps elle rencontre des grande difficulté en ce moment pas ce que la demande des clients devient de plus en plus élevé. donc a cet effet elle sollicite notre soutient pour réussir a satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Elle compte plus tard cet activité a des membre de sa famille.
texts.en: Jeanne is a 55-year-old woman who is married and the mother of 4 children aged between 34 and 25. One of her children has attended school. She has 3 grandchildren. She sells soft drinks but has been encountering great difficulties for a while due to the growing demand of her customers. Therefore she is requesting our support so that she is able satisfy her customer demand. In the future, she plans to pass on this business to some members of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Viviane Lablanche

texts.fr: Viviane est une femme de 22 ans fiancé père de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 10 mois et 05 ans. Elle a ouvert un petit comptoir au quartier qu'elle gère depuis 6 mois dans lequel elle commercialise la tomate, l'huile, les condiments et autres... Elle n'a pas un bon capital pourtant elle a une clientèle qui s'accroit au jour le jour. c'est pourcela qu'elle sollicite ce crédit qui lui permettra non seulement d'augmenter ses ventes mais aussi sa marge bénéficiaire. bénéfice qui sera réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Viviane is a 22-year-old woman who is engaged to her fiancé, a father of three children between the ages of ten months and five years old. She opened a small stall in her district that she has been running for the past six months in which she sells tomatoes, oil, condiments and other products.

She does not have a large amount of business capital, however she does have a clientele that grows daily. It is for this reason that Viviane is seeking a loan, which will not only allow her to increase her sales volume, but her profit margin as well. She plans to reinvest her income into her business so that she can expand it.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, oil, condiments, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Furqatjon

texts.ru:
Фуркатчон житель одного из районов города Худжанда. Ему 31 год. Он женат на швеи. Его жена занимается шитьем национальных женских платьев. У них двое детей. Сыновьям по 6 и по 4 годика. Фуркатчон считает, что ему очень повезло с такой женой, и он очень любит своих детей. 
   10 лет назад одноклассник Фуркатчона научил его чинить машины. И с тех пор ремонт легковых машин стала для него основной работой. С помощью своей деятельности Фуркатчон кормит свою семью. Он решил взять кредит и купить автозапчасти для легковых машин, чтобы расширить свою деятельность и чтобы его клиентам не приходилось искать не обходимые запчасти. Фуркатчон планирует еще больше работать и больше получать. Чтобы накопить деньги для образования сыновей.
texts.en: Furqatjon is a resident of one of the districts in the city of Khujand.  He is 31 years old and married to a seamstress.  His wife is involved in sewing women's national dresses.  They have two children.  Their sons are 6 and 4 years old.  Furqatjon thinks that he was fortunate to find his wife and loves his children very much.  Ten years ago, Furqatjon's classmate has taught him how to repair cars.  Since then, repairing passenger cars became his primary work.  Furqatjon feeds his family with the help of his business.  He decided to obtain a loan and purchase auto parts for passenger cars to expand his business and to help his customers find necessary spare parts.  Furqatjon plans to work more and earn more in order to save money for his sons' education.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Lily

texts.es:
Lily, es madre soltera y  tiene un hijo el cual esta en etapa escolar, viven en casa de su padre ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo, la casa se encuentra en la zona de Alpacoma en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja de forma particular como enfermera en domicilios prestando sus servicios, y con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos.
Solicita el crédito para la refacción de las paredes de su casa ya que actualmente se encuentran rajadas por la humedad y corre el riesgo de que puedan caerse. Con el préstamo anterior pudo arreglar una habitación.
El sueño de Lily es mejorar sus ingresos para darle una buena calidad de vida y seguridad a su hijo (que es una niña) ya que no cuenta con mas ayuda por que el padre de la niña solo le da 280 Bs por mes y con eso solo cubre algunos gastos.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Lily is a single mother of a child who is studying at school. She lives in her father's house in two room with brick walls. The house is located in the Alpacome area of La Paz. She works as a private nurse in homes providing her services. With her income she has to pay for food, education and basic services.

Lily is requesting a loan to repair the walls of her house which actually are deteriorated by the humidity and are threatening to cave in. With her last loan she was able to fix up a room. Lily's dream is to increase her income so she can give her daughter more security and a better standard of living. She has no other help as the father only gives them 280 BOB per month and this only pays for a few expenses. This is the second time she has worked with IMPRO and also her second loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to repair the walls of her house which have been deteriorated by the humidity.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Sokhorn is 56 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling cake for more than three years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a carpenter who produce beds to sell. He makes an income of $4 each day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $4 daily. Due to a lack of funds, Sokhorn is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase construction materials to build her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions. In the future, she would like to expand her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build her house

loans.name: Chamreun

texts.en: Chamreun is 49 years old, widowed and resides with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately USD $3 per day. Her children are employed. They are a teacher, an Internet shop owner and a waiter. They make an income of USD $20 daily. To improve her family’s finances, Chamreun is requesting a loan of USD $1000 to purchase computers for her son to expand his Internet shop. He then would be able to generate more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase computers for her son to expand his Internet shop

loans.name: Dilbarniso

texts.ru: Дом, где живет  Дилбарнисо, не отвечает стандартам жилья и она срочно должна отремонтировать свой дом. Ей 32 года, она разведена и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дети несовершеннолетние. Они учатся в средней школе и всегда просят мать отремонтировать их дом, но ее доход от купли продажи продуктов питания не достаточно для этого. Она должна заменить окна и двери, так как зимой они не держат теплоту дома внутри, а в Таджикистане зима довольно холодная. Из-за не удобства дома, у детей всегда насморк зимой. Дилбарнисо запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, окон и дверей для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: The house, where Dilbarniso lives, does not comply with living standards and she has to urgently repair her house.  She is 32 years old, divorced and raising two children.  The children are not of age.  They attend a secondary school and always ask their mother to repair their house, but her income from reselling food products is not enough for this.  She has to replace windows and doors because they do not hold the heat inside the house in the winter, and the winter in Tajikistan is fairly cold.  Due to the discomforts of the house, the children always have sinus issues in the winter.  Dilbarniso is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to purchase construction materials, windows and doors to repair her house.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials and repair her house

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es:
Bernardino continúa con la agricultura  y crianza de animales menores como cuyes y chanchos,y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes, chanchos y gallinas.
Bernardino nació en el distrito de Challabamba pero vive en la comunidad de Majopata anexo de la comunidad de Carnicero, él tiene 37 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de  la cual tiene cinco hijos. (La comunidad de Majopata está ubicada en el distrito del Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Bernardino is still farming and raising small animals such as guinea pigs and pigs, and it's going very well for him.  He needs this loan to buy small animals: guinea pigs, pigs, and hens.

Bernardino was born in the Challabamba district but lives in the community of Majopata, an annex of the community of Carnicero.  He's 37 years old and in a common-law relationship from which he has five children.  (Majopata is located in the Challabamba district in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, pigs, and hens

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian continúa con  la ganadería y a la agricultura pero también trabaja para una entidad pública, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono. 

Julian nació en el distrito de Challabamba pero vive en la comunidad de Majopata anexo de la comunidad de Carnicero, él tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene seis hijos y pertenece al banco comunal “El Balcon” (La comunidad de Majopata está ubicada en el distrito del Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Julian continues to raise livestock and farm. He also works for a public entity. At this time he needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. Julian was born in the district of Challabamba but lives in the community of Majopata, part of the community of Carnicero. (The community of Majopata is located in the district of Challabamba in the province of Paucartambo, Cusco Department, Peru).  He is 36 years old, married and has six children from this union. He belongs to the “El Balcon” communal bank

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron grills and an iron door.

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
María Ysabel tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotun , una zona rural donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, menestras, arroz, leche, aceite entre otros, son una familia emprendedora que se esfuerza por la labor que realiza, Ella ha solcitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Ysabel is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the district of Oyotun, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the North Coast of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, business and raise cattle.

María Ysabel sells groceries, legumes, rice, milk,oil, etc. They are a enterprising family who work hard for what they get. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN to buy merchandise to stock her business and in this way generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is operating a small store selling grocery items to the people in her neighborhood. According to her, she earns about 5,000 PHP monthly and uses it for sustenance for their meals and other bills at home. She wanted to increase her merchandise and sell more grocery items that is why she is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, milk, bread, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell. From this strategy, Merlita will be able to increase her sales and gain more income as well.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, bread, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Edith Ingrith

texts.es: La señora Edith tiene 20 años y tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 3 años y un bebe de 6 meses, la  señora Edith se dedica a la fabricación de plumas artificiales desde hace ya bastante tiempo, su taller  se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Dokwalla este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la  señora Edith va a usar este préstamo para la compra de materia prima (tela y palos) por su negocio. su razón para solicitar este préstamo es fuerte demanda de sus productos para las fiestas de carnaval ya que antes usaban plumas de aves que estaban en peligro de extinción y como ya lo prohibieron ella empezó a preservar la naturaleza realizando plumas sintéticas, por este motivo tiene mucha demanda la  señora Edith enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de efectivo para satisfacer la demanda, y va a utilizar los beneficios en ampliar el negocio comprando maquinas ya que ahora lo realiza de manera manual y con la maquinaria podría incrementar la producción, la  señora Edith es una persona joven emprendedora se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Edith is 20 years old and has two children, a 3-year-old and a baby of 6 months. Edith has made artificial feathers for quite some time. Her workshop is located in the Dokwalla area. This is her first loan cycle with the institution. Edith is going to use this loan to buy raw material (fabric and sticks) for her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is the strong demand for her products for carnival festivities. Before, they used feathers from birds in danger of extinction, and since they prohibited it, she began to preserve nature by making synthetic feathers. For this reason she has a lot of demand. Edith faces challenges in her business, one of which is a lack of cash to satisfy the demand, and she is going to use the profits to expand the business and buy machines, since right now she does it manually. With the machinery, she will be able to increase production. Edith is an entrepreneurial young person. She is grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (fabric and sticks)

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is 47 years old, married and has three children. She is selling fish, meat and vegetables. She offers them through a house to house selling basis. She hopes to offer more commodities that is why she is asking for the additional capital of 6,000 PHP. This loan will be used to buy more fish, vegetables and meat to sell. Zenaida hopes to keep improving her sales capacity and save some money for her family’s future expenses.

loans.use: to buy more fish, vegetables and meat to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 62, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is single, and she is working hard to provide income for her everyday needs.

Erlinda maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 15 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products, such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Erlinda hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat is 33-years-old. He and his wife are farmers and have two children. He is very hardworking and kind-natured. He has a lot of friends and all of them love him very much.

Shuhrat has been farming for six years, producing potatoes, carrots, wheat and maize. He has been in this line of work since he was a boy, so all of his experience has been dedicated to producing crops and vegetables. His products are sold at the local market in the region.  

In order to provide his crops with the needed attention, he is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Meet Teresia, a farmer living in Kisii, a prime area for banana and sugarcane growing. She is married and has three children; she has practiced farming for 21 years.  She produces and sells milk, tea, and eggs. She says that farming is her source of funds, and that's why she enjoys doing it and producing the best out of her farm. Her major challenge is poor roads, which leads to difficulty in accessing the local market.

Teresia chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they help small-scale farmers to grow economically, and they always train farmers before giving out loans to them. And their loans are always at a low interest rate.

This loan will help her purchase a dairy cow, which will lead to an increase in milk production and thus an increase in income.

This will ensure that her children receive a good education, and also improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mavrupat

texts.ru:
Маврупат  женщина пастух. Она отлично умеет разводить крупно рогатый скот и мелко  рогатый скот. Так как в семье не было сыновей, Маврупат с детство помогала отцу в скотоводстве. Теперь приобретённые навыки и занятия отца стали источником дохода Маврупат. Также она занимается дехканским хозяйством, от которого получает овощи, зелень и фрукты для ежедневного питания семьи. 
Вот уже тридцать лет она приносит "хлеб" в семью занимаясь  скотоводством.  В связи с временными трудностями связанное с финансами, Маврупат решила обратиться за кредитом в МДО "Арванд". С помощью Арванд она надеется,что улучшит  свой будущий доход и благосостояние семьи. На приобретенный кредит хочет купить корм и крупный рогатый скот. Заранее благодарит МДО "Арванд"  за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Mavrupat  tends farm animals. She is very skilled at raising cattle and small livestock. Since there were no sons in her family, Mavrupat has been helping out her father to raise livestock from childhood on. Now the skills she learned from her father help Mavrupat earn a living. She also has a small private farm and grows vegetables, herbs and fruits for her family table.

For over 30 years she has been her family’s breadwinner thanks to raising livestock. Due to temporary problems with financing, Mavrupat has decided to apply to MDO Arvand for a loan.  She hopes to be able to increase her revenue and improve her family’s life condition thanks to Arvand. She wants to use this loan to buy cattle and folder. Mavrupat thanks MDO Arvand in advance for its help and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
22 year old Hannah is a farmer living in the Ndaragwa area of Central Kenya. She has one child and has been doing farming for the past three years, where she produces and sells milk, eggs, and some vegetables. Hannah enjoys dairy farming most because it gives her more income as compared to other products. The challenge she faces is experiencing unstable milk prices.
Hannah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because their interest rates are affordable and they also give a grace period on their loans. She learned how to invest for her future and also farming. Hannah said that this loan will cause an increase in milk production and sales and thus an increase in income which will improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more home products for her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a buy and sell fingerlings business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing materials.

Josephine has been in this business for 33 years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: As the married mother of eight children, Sandra works hard to support her family. She earns a living by making food in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 6,000 from NWTF to buy more of the ingredients she uses to make her food. Sandra has sustained her business with two prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-making business.

loans.name: Sukriye

texts.en:
Şükriye is married, with two children. To contribute to her family, she began making and selling lace, decorative towel-edging, and booties. She sells them to her friends and neighbors. 

Her younger son had health problems which led Sukriye to spend a lot of time going to hospitals and physical therapy. She began to sell her work to the other patients there. Along with her handicrafts, she began to sell underwear, as well. To expand her business, she bought and sold sets for living rooms, blankets, and coverlets.

With the loan, Sukriye will buy underwear, coverlet sets, and blankets. "Because I always have to look after my children, I can't be dependent," she said.  "I have to keep working like this. My only wish is to complete my son's treatment in full and fulfill my older son's needs."

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Şükriye Hanım,evli ve 2 çocuğu var.  Ailesine katkı sağlamak için evde dantel,havlu kenarı ve patik yapıp satmakla başlamış.  Çevresine satıyor.  Daha sonra küçük oğlunun rahatsızlığı dolayısı ile hastanelere ve fizik rehabitilasyon merkezlerine çok sık gitmeye başlamış.  Burada ki hastalar ve hasta yakınlarına da el işlerini satmaya başlamış.  El işlerinin yanında iç çamaşırı satmaya başlamış.  İşi ilerledikçe koltuk takımları ,battaniyeler,pike takımları da siparişi üzerine alıp satıyor.  Aldığım kredi ile iç çamaşırı,pike takımı ve battaniye alacak.  Çocuğunun sürekli bakıma ihtiyacı olduğundan ben bir yere bağlanamaz.  İşime bu şekilde devam etmek zorundayım.  Tek ümidim oğlumun tedavisini tam olarak yapmak onun ve büyük oğlumun ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak.

loans.use: to buy underwear, coverlet sets, and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Nornita

texts.en:
Nornita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks for her general store business, like soap, sugar, eggs, milk, and canned goods.

Nornita has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from food-vending and raising pigs.

Nornita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks, like soap, sugar, eggs, milk, and canned goods.

loans.name: Sheril

texts.en: Sheril is 35 years old, married and the mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 30,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell such as sugar, milk and eggs. Sheril has been in this business for 11 years and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as sugar, milk and eggs.

loans.name: Geraline

texts.en:
Genaline is 42 years old, married and has children. She is a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Genaline operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo,  5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Genaline earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Genaline is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Genaline hopes to have a big grocery store and that her children will finish their education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and God.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Juje

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Juje works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fish vending. Juje is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools for her manicure business.

Juje has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools for her manicure business.

loans.name: Arusyak

texts.en:
Arusyak runs a small bakery in Yerevan. She makes different types of sweets, cakes and bread and sells them locally. As a very hard working mother of a son, she does her best to gather good income. 

Because of the financial hardships that Arusyak currently faces, it is very difficult for her to purchase needed materials and tools. Therefore, she has decided to ask for this loan. Arusyak has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a huge support for Arusyak and for her bakery to continue as her small business.

loans.use: to pay for materials and tools needed for her bakery

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 45 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Marilyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soy sauce, salt, sugar, coffee and cooking oil. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Belle Marie

texts.en:
Belle Marie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Belle Marie is requesting a loan from NWTF for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase materials such as thread, needles, fabrics, etc. for her tailoring business. Belle Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She hopes to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as thread, needles, fabrics, etc. for her tailoring

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 41 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Analie is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Analie has been farming sugarcane for nine years and earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en: Solidad, 46 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. She owns and operates a retail store where she sells a variety of food seasonings. She also sells plastic bags for additional income. She has been in this business for almost 20 years and earns a net profit of PHP 5,000 monthly. Her profits are usually spent on the school expenses of her son. Due to a lack of capital available for her business, she would like to borrow PHP 50,000 to purchase onions, food seasonings, soy sauce, vinegar, and plastic bags to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can able to improve and expand her business to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase onions, food seasonings, soy sauce, vinegar, and plastic bags to sell.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: El señor Joaquín tiene 58 años, estudio hasta nivel primario y tiene 10 hijos independientes. Vive en puerto Villarroel y se dedica a la pesca desde hace 15 años en su pequeño barco, pero en la época de veda es decir donde prohíben la pesca se dedica a prestar el servicio de turismo, para que este sea más eficiente solicita un crédito para la compra de un motor fuera de borda que tiene más capacidad para poder navegar más rápido, así podrá prestar un mejor servicio e incrementará sus ingresos.
texts.en: Joaquín is 58 years old. He studied through Primary school and has 10 independent children. He lives in the port of  Villarroel. For the past 15 years he has worked on his boat, but in the times of  prohibition, that is to say that fishing is prohibited, he works now in tourism. So that he has sufficient funds he is requesting  loan to buy a bigger outboard motor. Then he can travel faster, offer a better service and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy an outboard motor.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda tiene 67 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, y crianza de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de pavos y una segunda parte para la compra de harina ya que en las fiestas todos los productos suben de precio y desea contar con un stock, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 67 and lives with her husband in La Matanza, a district known for its carob trees. The people of La Matanza work are agriculturalists, traders and livestock breeders. It is located two hours from the city of Piura on the north coast of Peru.

She works selling chicha, a type of drink made from corn, and she also rears young animals in her backyard. She has requested a loan of 2,000 soles to buy balanced nutrition to fatten up her turkeys. She also wants to use part of the money to buy flour, as during festive periods prices drop, and she wants to stock up so that she can make more money for her family.

loans.use: To buy sacks of flour and balanced nutrition to fatten up her animals.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.en:
This is Nicanor, 28, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Sheryl, a housewife and a mother to their children. He and his wife manage their household while operating a variety store business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. He earns income by getting stock at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory.

Nicanor hopes that his business will grow bigger and dreams to have his own house. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cecilia Consuelo

texts.es:
Cecilia Consuelo tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales de corral pavos, gallinas y patos en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales pavos y cerdos para hacer crecer su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia Consuelo is 36 years old. She lives with her son in the district of Oyotun, two hours from Chiclayo on the North Coast of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

She buys and sells animals like turkeys, chickens and ducks in an area behind her house. She has requested a loan of 1,500 PEN to buy turkeys and pigs to expand her business and generate more revenues for her family.

loans.use: to buy turkeys and pigs to expand her business.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 35 years old and married with five children who are in school.  Angie works very hard to provide for them.

Angie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like milk, coffee and soft drinks to sell.

Angie has been in this business for three years.

In the future Angie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like milk, coffee and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en: Spartak is from Shnogh village where he lives together with his wife. The couple has been involved in retail business for 15 years. Spartak, for 10 years, has been also providing transportation of different products using his own truck. Because of financial hardships that the family currently faces, Spartak asks this loan. It is important for him to pay for the renovation of the truck and purchase fruit to resell. Spartak has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is important for Spartak to continue his work and he will be very grateful to all lenders for support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the truck and purchase fruits for resale

loans.name: Josphat's Group

texts.en:
Amani Group is a group of five group leader farmers in Kakamega North District, with Josphat selected as the Kiva representative. Josphat has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. He also joined One Acre Fund because he wanted better harvests. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 64 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Josphat is a reliable member of the community. He is married with five children. He is 38 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 16 years to support his family. In addition to this, Josphat is very active in his community and is involved in the savings group. He described his harvest last year as not being with One Acre Fund. He hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer he will be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program!

The 2013 Long Rains season will be Josphat’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to get new farming methods. As an active member in his community, Josphat also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader. Josphat plans on using future profits from the harvest to save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business. He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Josphat and the Amani Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will continue providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To support farmers in purchasing hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase better harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 33 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Annie is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Annie has been in the pig-fattening business for six years and earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 32 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emilia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from rice retailing.

Emilia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wayna Orco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WAYNA ORCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana Agutina  ella es conviviente y tiene 54 años y tiene; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura,la socia tiene un terreno donde siembra papa y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8.00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las papas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papas.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de granos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Wayna Orco” communal bank located in the district and province of Paucartambo, in Cusco department.

One member is Ana Agustina who is married and 54 years of age. She works in her agricultural business and has her own land where she plants potatoes and, later, sells the harvest in different markets. Ana works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. She has been in this business for 8 years, and it is going very well. Her dream is to have her own stall where she could sell her potatoes. Ana requests the loan to buy potatoes to plant.
 
The other members are also dedicated to agriculture, including a business that sells grains, another that sells groceries, and another that sell animals.

Ana is very grateful to all those who form part of her dream in this manner, and she promises to comply with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Celia works hard to support her family.

She has a business direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines and also earns income from rice retailing. Celia is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to purchase lotion, soap, etc. to sell.
