So Akila want to earn some more income by expanding her business. With the present loan, she wants to purchase a pico (sewing) machine and some cloth to sew school uniforms for the students. She hopes this will help her to increase her income. Akila hopes to save some money to construct a house of her own.

The other three members of this group are Sabana, Rajiaa and Roshan who have poultry, tailoring and footwear businesses, respectively.

loans.use: To pay for a sewing machine and cloth.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre casado de 32 años de edad , quien vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas la primera de 2 años y la segunda de tres años quienes viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Pedro comenta que tiene una tienda de zapatos en la ciudad capital y viaja dos veces por semana para verificar como va su negocio y los otros días trabaja como jornalero en el campo. Como también ha tomado la iniciativa de seguir estudiando ya que por el momento estudia enfermería en Quetzaltenango, esto lo realiza con el propósito de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia ya que cuando él era pequeño  no tuvo la oportunidad de tener a sus padres porque fallecieron.
Ahora por el progreso que ha tenido su negocio en cuanto a sus ganancias ha decidido terminar la construcción de su vivienda,  por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de materiales para acabados de construcción. Este préstamo lo pagara con el negocio de zapatos que cuenta ahora.
Su mayor sueño es graduarse de enfermero y poder terminar la construcción de su vivienda para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Pedro, 32, is married and lives with his wife and two daughters, ages two and three in the Solola region.  

Pedro has a shoe store in the capital city and travels there twice a week to oversee the business.  The rest of the time he works as a hired farm worker.  He is also continuing his education and currently studying nursing in Quetzaltenango.  His aim is to improve his family's quality of life because when he was young he was not fortunate enough to have his parents around long before they died.

Now, due to the progress his business has had as far as profits are concerned, he wants to finish building his house.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 GTQ to buy construction finishing materials.  He will pay back the loan with income from his shoe business.

His greatest desire is to get his nursing degree and finish his house for his family's comfort.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more newspapers for her newsstand. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for her to buy more newspapers for her newsstand. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Editha hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work. This is where she finds strength and inspiration by the word of God that they study as a group.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more newspapers for her newsstand.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de San Felipe, una comunidad ubicada en la carretea Belaunde Terry, lo que le ha permitido a su población a dedicarse a la venta de comida preparada a los pasajeros que transitan por la zona, comercio de frutas y cultivo de los mismos, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad Jaén, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta y cultivo de lima desde hace varios años, cuenta con clientela considerable en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de de abonos y de esta manera, mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos de lima para ofrecerlos a un mejor precio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 52 years old, and lives with his wife in the San Felipe district, a community located on the Belaunde Terry highway, 2 hours away from Jaén on the north coast of Peru. This has allowed the population to find work selling prepared food to travelers passing through the area, growing and selling fruit. 

Pedro has worked growing and selling limes for several years, and has a considerable clientele in the area. He is asking for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to buy fertilizers. This will improve the quality of his lime crops and he will be able to offer them at a better price, increasing his income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda is an industrious woman. Born in 1957, she is married and has four children. Mavjuda has been busy selling food items more than 10 years. She sells her goods, such as chocolates and biscuits, near the pedagogical college. She also works as security in the college at night. Her husband is a driver and her two sons work in Russia. 

Mavjuda and her family live in an old house. She wants to repair the house and with this goal she came to IMON. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to buy building materials for home repairs. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 28 años, está casada y tiene un hijo de 7 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia. María se dedica al alquiler de mototaxi, el cual da a un chofer cada día muy temprano; también se tiene una segunda ocupación que es la venta de zapatos y sandalias, de manera quincenal o mensual, dependiendo de la demanda de sus productos. Para obtener su mercadería viaja a otra ciudad  en autobús por mas de 20 horas, desde ahí realiza el mismo viaje de retorno trayendo gran cantidad de artículos para venderlos entre sus familiares, amigos y demás personas. Realiza sus ventas de forma ambulatoria, recorriendo todos los días las principales calles de la ciudad en busca de clientes que deseen comprar algo de lo que ofrece o en ocasiones lo hace por pedidos hechos con anticipación. Desde que comenzó en éste negocio le ha ido muy bien gracias a su carisma y a la calidad de cada uno de los artículos que vende. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.2000, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometida una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado desea incrementar la variedad de sus productos comprando mayor cantidad de zapatos, sandalias y además diversas prendas de vestir para venderlos. También invertirá en el mantenimiento de mototaxi.
texts.en: Maria is 28 years old.  She is married and has a seven-year-old son, and lives with her family in their own home.  Maria works renting out a motorcyle taxi, which is provided to a driver very early every day. She also has a second occupation selling shoes and sandals, either biweekly or monthly depending on the demand for her products.  In order to obtain her merchandise she travels for more than 20 hours by bus to another city.  She then returns with a large number of products to sell to her family, friends and other people.  She works as a mobile vendor, travelling through the main streets of the city every day in search of customers who want to buy what she is selling.  Sometimes she takes orders in advance.  This business has been doing well since she started it, thanks to her charisma and the quality of each of the products that she sells.  She is now requesting a loan of 2000 PEN, for which she is grateful to those who will make it possible for her to continue with her goals.  She is very committed again to making her payments punctually.  With the sum requested she would like to increase the variety of her products by buying a larger number of shoes, sandals and articles of clothing to sell.  She would also like to invest in maintenance for the motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals and articles of clothing, among other things.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie works hard to support her five children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Julie requests a 1,800 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a solar lamp.

She is purchasing the solar lamp because she wants to have backup lighting in case of an emergency.

Julie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 49 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonisa is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Leonisa has been raising pigs for 3 years and earns additional income from working in a general store.

She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 47 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, egg, noodles, etc.

She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, egg, noodles, etc

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 55 years old, married, and has seven children. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. 

Lucresia requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizer for her farm.

She has been farming rice for 20 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucresia would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 33 years old and married with two children.

Emelie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Emelie has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years, and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Emelie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Leiver David

texts.es:
Leiver  tiene 22 años de edad es soltero tiene 2 hijos de 11 años y 7 años de edad, vive con la familia en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Bruniquilde que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Calabi, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.
Leiver  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Las compras lo realizan en comercial Rodríguez. Solicita el crédito  para la compra de insumos como los abonos, ureas, fertilizantes  que es un apoyo económico. Su sueño es mejorar la economía de la  familia. Los desafíos que se  enfrentan  dificultades económicas. 
Le gusta realizar bingos para recoger dinero para obras del sector.
texts.en:
Leiver is 22 years old, single, and has two children (ages 11 and 7). He lives with his family in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Leiver is a member of the Communal Bank "Bruniquilde", which is located in the neighborhood of Calabi in the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in farm work.

Leiver is a farmer who grows corn. His purchases are conducted at the Rodríguez commercial district. He is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as compost, urea, and fertilizers. This will be a great financial help.

His dream is to improve his family's financial situation. The challenges he faces include dealing with financial difficulties. Leiver enjoys playing bingo in order to raise money for local projects.

loans.use: to buy compost, urea, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ma. Jurie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ma. Jurie works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Ma. Jurie is borrowing PHP 10,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to resell in her rice retailing business.

Ma. Jurie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Cabelen

texts.en:
Cabelen is 24 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Cabelen is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her livestock.

Cabelen has been raising livestock for five years and earns additional income from buy-and-sell bananas.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her livestock.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jennifer works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming corn. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items to resell, such as shampoos, milk, coffee, soap, etc. for her general store business.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items, such as shampoos, milk, coffee, soap, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a 28-year-old woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is married and has an 8-year-old child. She is a barbecue vendor. She sells chicken and pork barbecue to earn a living. Her business started three years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy materials and ingredients like chicken and pork meat and seasonings to continue her business and meet the family's daily needs.

In the future, Maricel hopes to expand her barbecue vending business to improve her income and also to improve her child's welfare.

loans.use: to buy materials and ingredients like chicken and pork meat and seasonings

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more items like biscuits, candies, snack foods, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for nine years; she earns more income from raising livestock.

Conchita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items like biscuits, candies, snack foods, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
As the married parent of three children, Ma. Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Ma. Elena is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Ma. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 32 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Egleen

texts.en:
Egleen is 23 years old and has one child. Egleen is married and her child is in school.

Egleen is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Egleen requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

Egleen has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Egleen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en: Arman lives in Kapan town with his wife and 2-year-old daughter. Arman has been providing renovation services to locals for the past four years. Over these years of hard work, Arman has gained a good reputation among locals who value the high quality work that Arman does. The tools with which Arman works are too old, and Arman needs to replace them with new ones. Therefore, he has decided to apply for this loan to be able to purchase new tools needed to provide renovation services. Arman has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a huge help for Arman, and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy tools for providing renovation services

loans.name: Gladys Group

texts.en:
Gladys is in her early 30's and is single with one child who is still in school. She has been operating a business selling bags for six years. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Gladys's first loan from ID Ghana, and she wants to use it to buy bags to resell to customers. She dreams of buying her products from abroad.

Gladys will share this loan amount of 1700 GHS with her group of three members. They will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy bags to resell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is a 25-year-old, married woman. She lives with her husband and son, in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is providing transportation services for passengers, in his auto rickshaw. Her husband has been doing this work since about three years ago. To carry out his work, he gets up very early, because he has to look for passengers on the streets of his city. He has been driving by day and by night. This is the reason the rickshaw has experienced serious depreciation, due to his continuous driving.
 
Due to a lack of cash in hand, Asia requested a loan. With the loan funds, her husband will buy spare parts for the vehicle, such as headlights, bolts, tyres, tubes, and the like.
 
Now her husband feels tranquil and comfortable, because he has assurance of a regular income and more free time. This will be Asia's third loan with Kiva; she hopes that, with your cooperation, her husband will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make the loan payments on time.
Note: Asia raises her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Irlanda

texts.es:
Irlanda tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica una comunidad que presenta grandes depósitos de arena, piedra y ripio, que su población lo emplea en construcción, tiene un relieve llano, rodeo por cerros debido a los contrafuertes andinos, su población se dedica a la a agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como pollos, gallinas, gallos, patos; con más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Irlanda is 39 years old, and lives with her two children in the Nueva Arica district, a community an hour away from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru. The Nueva Aria district offers large deposits of sand, rock and rubble, which the population use in construction, and it has a flat landscape surrounded by hills due to the Andean spurs. Its population works in agriculture, business and raising livestock.

Irlanda works raising and selling animals such as hens, roosters, and ducks, and she has more than 15 years experience in the business, which is located at her home. She has asked for a loan of 4000 nuevos soles in order to buy more animals. This investment will be used increase the variety and productivity of the animals, and so increase the income for her family.

loans.use: to buy animals such as chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Hermila

texts.es:
Hermila tiene 65 años de edad, vive junto esposo y sus hijas, en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida arroz con pollo, cabrito, arroz con pato entre otros, en el mercado de la zona, es conocida por los exquisitos platos que preparado, es una mujer emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de ingredientes para sus preparos y de esta manera seguir generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Hermila is 65 years old and lives with her husband and daughters in the Cayalti district which is located 2 hours away from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru. The population works in agriculture, business, and raising livestock.

Hermila works preparing and selling food such as rice with chicken, goat or duck, among other things. She is known in the local market for the delicious dishes she prepares. She is an enterprising woman, and she has asked for a loan of 2500 nuevos soles in order to buy ingredients for preparing her food, and in this way continue earning an income for her family.

loans.use: buy ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Nelida Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en la zona rural de Zaña, una comunidad ubicada cerca al valle del rio Jequetepeque, a una hora con cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de leche desde hace más de 5 años, comercializando la leche en su domicilio y mercado de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para su ganado y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Herlinda is 29 years old and lives with her husband and children in the rural region of Zaña, a community located near the Jequetepeque river valley, an hour and forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

Herlinda has been raising cattle and selling milk for the past five years.  She sells the milk from her home and in the local market.  She is requesting a loan of 1,500 nuevo soles to buy feed for her cattle and thus generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica, de 35 años, está casada y tiene 03 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Mónica, consiste en al venta de productos dulces, específicamente de golosinas, su puesto está ubicado en su casa propia, es muy concurrido por sus clientes, ya que esta muy bien situada en su barrio y ella es muy conocida por su buen humor y carisma, lo cual ha hecho que sus ventas le den los ingresos que necesita. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y hacerlos reír, lleva 03 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que vender bajo los fuertes rayos solares de la mañana, le encantaría tener una tienda de golosinas donde pueda vender con más comodidad y ofrecer otros tipos de productos a sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.600, por tanto esta muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará productos al por mayor como golosinas para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de empezar a aumentar con algunos productos comestibles e iniciar con su nuevo proyecto.
texts.en:
Mónica, 35 years old, is married and has 3 children with whom she lives in her own house. Mónica's work consists of selling sweets, specifically candy. Her stand is located in her own house. It is well frequented by her customers, because it has a good location in the neighborhood. She is also very well known for her good humor and charisma, which have allowed her sales to provide her with the income she needs.

What she likes most about her work is conversing with her customers and making them laugh. She has been in this business for 3 years. She would love to have a candy store where she can sell more comfortably and offer other types of products to her customers.

At this time, she is applying for a loan of S/600, and is very happy knowing that she will have financial support, because she will feel secure moving forward with her business. With the requested amount she will buy wholesale products like candy to offer her customers, as well as begin to expand with some eatables and begin with her new project.

loans.use: to buy candy and eatables.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una comunidad que presenta grandes depósitos de arena, piedra y ripio, que su población lo emplea en construcción, tiene un relieve llano, rodeo por cerros debido a los contrafuertes andinos, su población se dedica a la a agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral patos, pollos, cuyes, en su domicilio, con muchos años de experiencia, sus hijos le apoyan en esta labor, José Manuel ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de animales y de esta manera tener una mejor producción de los mismos para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Manuel is 43 years old and lives with his children in the District of Nueva Arica. This community is known for having large deposits of sand, stone, and gravel. As a result, the area provides construction jobs. The topography is flat since it lies at the foothills of the Andean mountains. The people in this area engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

José Manuel raises domesticated animals such as ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs from his home. He has many years of experience and his children help with the work. José Manuel is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy balanced feed for fattening his animals. This will result in better production so that he can offer animals to his customers, thereby generating more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Silo Marty

texts.es:
Silo Marty tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad tranquila, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, Silo también ofrece servicios como jornalero en los cultivos de la zona, El ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y una segunda parte para la compra de cerdos y de esta manera incrementar su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Silo Marty is 33 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Oyotún district, a tranquil community where its residents are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from Chiclayo, along the northern coast of Peru.

He and his wife raise and sell small animals in an area behind their house.  Silo also works as a field hand on the area farms.  He is asking for a loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles so he can buy balanced feed for his animals and also use some of it to buy pigs, thereby generating more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and pigs.

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.ru: Зулфинисо порядочная женщина. Она пережила много тягости жизни. Ее муж умер несколько лет назад. Зулфинисо осталась вдовой с маленькой дочкой. Ее дочери 10 лет. Она учится в средней школе. Зулфинисо упорно работает для того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и обеспечить свою дочь. Зулфинисо не имеет высшее образование. Она данное время работает дворником в местной больнице. Она получает ежемесячную зарплату. Зулфинисо хочет купить телевизор для своего домохозяйства, но не имеет денег. Она хочет, чтобы ее дочь смотрела телевизор и была информирована от новшества мира. Зулфинисо запрашивает займ на сумму 3800 сомони для покупки телевизора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zulfiniso is a respectable woman. She lived through a lot of hardship in her life. Her husband died a few years ago. Zulfiniso was left as a widow with a young daughter. Her daughter is 10 years old and goes to secondary school. Zulfiniso works persistently in order to earn money to support her daughter. 

Zulfiniso does not have higher education. She currently works as a cleaning lady at the local hospital. She receives a monthly income. Zulfiniso would like to purchase a TV for her household, but does not have the money. She would like her daughter to watch TV and be informed about innovations in the world. 

Zulfiniso requests a loan in the amount of 3,800 somoni to purchase a TV. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a TV for her household

loans.name: Gabriel Maribel

texts.es:
Marible tiene 43 años de edad, vive con esposo, en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se caracteriza por cultivos de algodón, yuca, maíz, arroz, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, menestras, azúcar, arroz, leche entre otros, es una mujer emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marible is 43 years old and lives with her huband in the Oyotún district, a tranquil community where its residents are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from Chiclayo, along the northern coast of Peru.

She sells primary needs products such as food, sugar, rice, milk, and other things.  She is an enterprising woman and is asking for a loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles to buy merchandise to stock her business so she can increase her family income.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 51 years old and married with six children. Trinidad works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

She has been running the general store for two years, and also earns an income from farming sugar cane.

Trinidad has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Trinidad aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines. Jocelyn has been in this business for three years now.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, laundry soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, laundry soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. She is married, and has had a food vending business in the Philippines for two years.

Grace requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Grace would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Delia Cristina

texts.es:
La señora  Delia, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica a tiempo a su negocio, el cual es una tienda de abarrotería que funciona desde hace 20 años. 
Doña Delia  su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su casa de habitación atendiendo en la comodidad de su hogar a las personas que llegan a la tienda en busca de la variedad de productos. 
Doña Delia  el crédito lo necesita para la compra de: frijoles, café, leche, arroz, azúcar, refrescos, pan, huevos, manteca, etc. El impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es que sus ventas se incrementen ya que comprará variedad de producto con el fin de poder satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes.
 Doña Delia  los planes a futuro, es seguir creciendo en su actividad, y generar mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida, al mismo tiempo ayudar a su familia en cualquier problema que surja.



Choluteca, Honduras  de  Diciembre del 2013
texts.en:
Sra. Delia lives in southern Honduras and has been in business for quite some time. Her grocery store has been in operation for 20 years.

Doña Delia's business is located in her home, which allows her to comfortably attend to her customers. They come to her store in order to find a variety of products.

Doña Delia needs this loan in order to buy beans, coffee, milk, rice, sugar, soft drinks, bread, eggs, lard, and other products. The expected impact of this loan is that her sales will increase. She already buys a variety of products so that she can satisfy the needs of each individual customer.

Her plans for the future are to continue growing her business and to generate more income so that she can have a better quality of life. At the same, she wants to help her family with any problems that may arise.

Choluteca, Honduras - December 2013

loans.use: to buy beans, coffee, milk, rice, sugar, soft drinks, bread, eggs, lard, and other products.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette works hard to support six children. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Jeanette requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Jeanette is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is 38 years old; she lives with her husband and her two children in Jinen, where they live with her husband’s family.  Her dream is to build a separate house.  

She has been selling clothes and shoes for six months; she works hard to support her husband and to provide good living conditions for her children.

Majida is asking Ryada for this loan to buy goods to sell (shoes and clothes); this will allow her to increase her stock.  

Her dream is to expand her business, and she desires to use part of the profits on her children’s education in the future.
 
Majida is very grateful to everyone who helps her. Her husband, appears in the photo; for cultural reasons, she can’t publish her photo online, so she apologies.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Maricel is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricel has been in the pig-fattening business for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Menjil

texts.en:
Menjil is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Menjil is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.
business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines. Menjil requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of used clothes to sell.

Menjil has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Menjil would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase adiitional sacks of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Darlina

texts.en:
Darlina works hard to support her family. Darlina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Darlina is borrowing PHP 4,600 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Darlina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, she's helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Edona

texts.en:
Edona is 59 years old and married. She has four children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for three years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

Edona is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a soft drinks vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Delia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional cases of soft drinks to sell for her soft drinks vending business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Josamie

texts.en:
Josamie is 18 years old and is the first of four children in her family. Her mother, Josephine, supports the family with her fishing business in the Philippines.

Josamie is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. Currently she is in her second semester of this four-year course. She is borrowing PHP 5,000 to pay her tuition for the second semester of the school year 2013-14.

When she graduates, Josamie plans to be gainfully employed. She wants to help improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to pay her tuition for the second semester of her first year, studying toward a B.S. in Information Technology.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a farmer who lives in Kisii, an area known for banana- and sugarcane-growing. He has practiced farming for four years, producing and selling milk, eggs, and bananas. He enjoys farming so much, because he gives his dairy cows the right treatment so they will produce more milk.

Jackson chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, because they will help him purchase a dairy cow that will produce more milk for him, and the interest rate on their loans is affordable for small-scale farmers. During the training he received from Juhudi Kilimo, he learned how to develop a savings culture. This loan will give him more milk, and thus more income, which in turn will improve his living standard.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow.

loans.name: Nabijon

texts.en:
Nabijon was born in Tajikistan in 1985. He has no higher education. Nabijon always wanted to be higher educated but he does not have the opportunity. 

Nabijon is a builder and builds houses for his neighbors and friends. He has ‘golden hands’. His clients are happy with his work. 

He earns additional income from growing agricultural products. This year, he didn't have a good harvest. His income was small, and he does not have enough money to buy clothes for his two small children and to buy food items for his large family including his parents and brothers. 

Nabijon is asking for a loan of 1500 TJS to buy clothes for his children and food items for his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes for his children and food for his family

loans.name: Emee

texts.en:
Emee is 32 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school. Emee is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. 

Emee requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Emee has been raising livestock for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emee would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed, and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Gilma Ines

texts.es:
Gilma  tiene 45 años de edad es soltera vive con sus tres hijos en el Cantón  Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Bruniquilde que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Calabi, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.
Gilma  se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno para la siembra.  Las compras realiza en el  Cantón Ventanas en el  Comercial  García. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para el cultivo para no arrendar. El desafío que enfrenta es  el trabajo contra la maleza. En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirce los fines de semana en la casa con toda la familia.
texts.en:
Gilma is 45 years old, single, and lives with her three children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. She is a member of the Communal Bank "Bruniquilde", which is located in the neighborhood of Calabi in the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in farm work.

Gilma grows corn and raises chickens and pigs. She is requesting a loan in order to rent farmland for planting. Her purchases are conducted in the canton of Ventanas at the García commercial district.

Gilma's dream is to buy a plot of land for her crops so that she no longer has to rent. The challenge she faces is having to deal with crop diseases in her work. During her free time on the weekends, she enjoys spending time with her entire family at home.

loans.use: to rent farmland for planting.

loans.name: M. Iqbal

texts.en:
M. Iqbal is 57, living with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

He has been running a small general store for five years; earlier he had a job in a government sector. After retirement, he established a general store with the help of a graduity amount (small bonus) so that he can equally participate in household expenses. His shop is situated in a populated area, and there are a lot of customers available here to buy miscellaneous general store items. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable for daily usage. He wants to offer additional bakery items such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, pattis, etc. But the major problem is the shortage of funds.

Therefore, M. Iqbal requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he would be able to buy additional bakery items such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, pattis, etc.

He is very glad after taking this loan, hopeful that he will be successful in fulfilling each request for any item, and abstain from the disappointment of his customers. In this way he will be able to generate maximum profit from the sale of additional bakery items. 

M. Iqbal is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy additional bakery items for his general store.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is 20 years old. She lives with her retired parents and four siblings, in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq. Hanan is studying for her Bachelor's Degree. She was majoring in Mathematics initially, and then she changed her major to Earth and Environment Science. She is in her third year. She is planning to start her professional life after graduation, to support her family financially and to improve herself. To do so, she needs to buy the stationery, books, and other tools for her study, and to pay for her upcoming semester tuition. But she doesn't have enough money. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition and buy the stationery, books, and other learning tools she needs for her study of Earth and Environment Science.

loans.name: Guliko

texts.en:
Guliko is from the village of Aghaiani. She is 21 years old, married, and lives with her husband, infant son, and mother-in-law. 

The only breadwinner in the household is Guliko's husband who works at a car wash for a monthly salary.

It’s often difficult for the family to cover food costs, so Guliko has decided to purchase a milking cow and start a dairy business. She will produce cheese for selling as well as for the family's consumption. 

This loan will be a great support for her family since it will help generate income. Guliko hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow and start a cheese making business

loans.name: Hatice

texts.en:
Hatice is married with four children.  She had made trousseaux and knit gifts at home for her friends and neighbors.  

When she learned the municipality had opened an arcade for housewives to sell their handicrafts, she was thrilled.  “Why don’t I sell what I make?” she thought.  She applied to open a stall in the arcade.  Now she sells the tulle and lace sets, as well as knitted items, that she makes at home at her booth.  She also makes handicrafts during her spare time at the booth.  Sometimes she makes items to order, she says.  

With the loan, she wants to increase her variety of products.  She’ll use her loan to buy supplies for lace, tulle and knitting.  With a greater variety of goods her sales will rise.  For now, she likes selling items at the arcade.  In the future she would like to open a store with her daughter.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Hatice Hanım,evli ve 4 çocuğu var.  Evde, çevresine hediyelik çeyizlik işler,örgüler yapıyordu.  Belediye’nin ,ev kadınlarına  el işlerini yapıp satmaları için açtığı bir pasajı görünce çok etkilenmiş.  Neden  yaptıklarımı satmıyorum diye düşünmüş.  Müracaat edip pasajda tezgah istemiş.  Evde tülden ve küpürden yaptığı oda takımlarını,örgü işlerini şimdi tezgahında satıyor.  Burada da boş durmuyor hem satış hem de el işlerini yapıyor.  Bazen sipariş verirler o zamanda sipariş üzerine çalıştığını söylüyor.
Aldığı kredi ile çeşidini arttıracak.  Küpürler,tüller,örgü için yünler alacak.Çeşit çok olunca satışları artıyor.Şimdilik burada ki tezgahında satış yapması hoşuna gidiyor .İleride kızı ile birlikter dükkan açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy supplies for lace, tulle and knitting

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a conservative woman, so she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Amal was born in 1977. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq, with her six sons and daughters, and her retired husband. One of her sons is studying for a Bachelor's Degree, majoring in Sports Training and Management. He is in his first year. He is planning to start working in his study field after graduation, to improve himself. But Amal doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees, as a result of financial problems they are facing. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Гулшан живет и работает в столице Таджикистана. Она родилась в 1956 году. Гулшан вдова и имеет 2 детей. Гулшан сама вырастила своих детей с большим трудом, так как она имеет маленькую зарплату. Гулшан работает в местной больнице уборщицей. Гулшан и ее дети живут в старом доме, которое имеет плохое состояние. Гулшан не имеет достаточно денег, чтобы сделать ремонт. Она хочет отремонтировать дом и с такой целью она обратилась в ИМОН. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulshan lives and works in the capital of Tajikistan.  She was born in 1956.  Gulshan is a widow and has 2 children.  Gulshan raised her children herself with a lot of difficulties because she has a small salary.  Gulshan works as a janitor at a local hospital.  Gulshan and her children live in an old house that is in a bad condition.  Gulshan does not have enough money to make repairs there.  She wants to repair her house and came to IMON to achieve this goal.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 US dollars to purchase construction materials, such as cement, wood, paint, etc.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as cement, wood, paint, etc., to repair her house

loans.name: Bertsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Bertsetseg, 51 years old, lives with her younger son in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. They live in a house on a plot of land. 

She has been working as nurse for a state hospital for 33 years; her younger son studies at university in his second year. The house they live in has a poor floor made with planks, and during winter, the house becomes so cold. 

So she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to install a low pressure heater in the house. 

This will make the house more comfortable, and a warmer place to live. Also, she will burn less coal for heating, thus release less pollutants into the air. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to install a low pressure heater

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es:
Benjamín, a sus 63 años de edad, es una víctima más del desplazamiento forzado por la ola de violencia que se vivía en su ciudad natal, se trasladó con su familia dejando atrás todo lo que había construido durante muchos años de trabajo. Luego de radicarse comenzó a vender frutas de manera ambulante, como una alternativa que le permitiera generar recursos para sustentar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y sus 3 hijos; poco a poco fue adquiriendo clientela y logró reconocimiento en el sector, trabaja solo todos los días de 4 am a 4 pm, generando los recursos necesarios para apoyar económicamente a sus hijos durante los 20 años que lleva laborando de manera independiente.
Benjamín sueña con poder tener su negocio en un local comercial en el que pueda ofrecer muchos más productos y, con el firme propósito de seguir luchando para cumplir ese sueño, encuentra en el crédito un apoyo para lograrlo, con el dinero desea comprar surtido al por mayor (frutas, mecato y dulces), así podrá diversificar los productos que ofrece y ampliará su mercado poco a poco, mejorando las ventas y los ingresos que percibe; con los que espera tener la capacidad para brindar mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar a sus familiares y, en un futuro tener la oportunidad de disfrutar una vejez tranquila y sin preocupaciones monetarias.
texts.en:
Benjamín, age 63, is a victim of displacement that was forced upon him by a wave of violence that hit his hometown. As a result, he moved his family and left behind everything he had built up over many years of work. After the move, he began selling fruit as a street vendor. This provided the means of generating income for meeting the basic needs of his wife and their three children. Little by little, he began acquiring customers and achieved recognition in the neighborhood. He works alone every day from 4:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M. Throughout the 20 years he has worked independently, he has been able to generate the necessary income to financially support his children.

Benjamín dreams of having his own business at a commercial center where he can offer more products. He fully intends to keep striving in order to fulfill that dream. Having a loan will help to achieve that goal. The money will be used to buy inventory in bulk such as fruits, pastries, and sweets. This will enable him to diversify the products he offers and gradually expand his market. As a result, his sales and income will improve. He hopes to be able to provide better living conditions and improved well-being for his loved ones.

In the future, Benjamín hopes to have the opportunity to enjoy a peaceful retirement with no financial worries.

loans.use: to buy fruits, pastries, and sweets in bulk.

loans.name: Mahfizakhon

texts.ru: Махфизахон порядочная женщина. Она родилась в 1984 году. Махфизахон замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 не совершеннолетних детей. Махфизахон занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она этим бизнесом занимается уже более 7 лет. Махфизахон шьёт национальные женские платья. Она предоставляет свои услуги дома. Клиентами Махфизахона являются ее друзья и соседи. Она старается предоставлять свои услуги на высшем уровне. Махфизахон также шьёт платья и продает на местном рынке. Она хочет развевать свой бизнес. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки ткани. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mahfizakhon is a decent woman. She was born in 1984. Mahfizakhon is married and raising two children. Mahfizakhon works with sewing women's clothing. She has worked with this business for 7 years already. 

Mahfizakhon sews women's national dresses. She provides this service from her house. Mahfizakhon's customers are her friends and neighbors. She tries to provide a service of the highest quality. Mahfizakhon also sews dresses and sells them at the local market. She would like to develop her business. 

Mahfizakhon requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni to purchase fabric. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy fabric for sewing dresses

loans.name: Saira Yamileth

texts.es:
La joven Saira  Yamileth  de 27 años de edad, vive con su esposo  y sus tres  hijos tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 02 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería sus clientes le prefieren por su buen trato y buenos precios.
Saira Yamileth su venta es de lunes a domingo, desea crecer más en su negocio y espera que con el préstamo que solicita a Prisma pueda suplir la necesidad de financiamiento.
Saira Yamileth está solicitando el préstamo para compra de arroz, frijoles, papas, lechuga, plátanos, refrescos, jabón, detergentes, maíz, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es su primer crédito que solicita a prisma.
Saira Yamileth su sueño es mejorar su condición de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Saira Yamileth is a 27-year-old young woman. She lives with her husband and their three children and owns her home. She has been working selling groceries for two years. Her customers prefer her because she treats them well and offers good prices.

She sells groceries Monday through Sunday. She wants her business to grow and expects that the loan she is requesting from Prisma will cover her need for financing.

She is requesting this loan to buy rice, beans, potatoes, lettuce, plantains, soft drinks, soap, detergents, corn, etc. She plans to use this loan to help improve her income as well as her quality of life. This is the first loan she requests from Prisma. Her dream is to improve her living conditions.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November, 2013

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, potatoes, lettuce, plantains, soft drinks, soap, detergents, corn, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо родилась в 1960 году. Зулайхо прекрасная женщина и заботливая мать 3 детей. Она разведена и сама вырастила своих детей. Ее дети Давлат, Саидчафар и Зулола совершеннолетние. Зулайхо имеет высшее образование. Она педагог-психолог. Зулайхо более 30 лет работала педагогом. Данное время она работает психологом в детском садике. Зулайхо гордится своей работой. Она использует свою зарплату для обеспечения семьи. Ее дочь Зулола скоро выходит замуж и она должна дать ей приданное и провести свадебное торжество. Однако Зулайхо не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своей дочери и купить приданное. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zulaykho was born in 1960. She is a wonderful woman and loving mother of three children. She is divorced and raised her children by herself. Her children, Davlat, Saidchafar and Zulola, are adults now. Zulaykho has higher education. She is an educational psychologist. She has worked as a pedagogue for more than 30 years. Currently she works as a psychologist in kindergarten.

Zulaykho is proud of her work. She uses her pay to support her family. Her daughter, Zulola, is getting married soon, and Zulaykho needs to give her dowry and hold a wedding party. She does however not have sufficient funding for this. 

Zulaykho requests a loan in the amount of 7,500 somoni to hold her daughter's wedding party and to purchase dowry. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To hold a wedding party for her daughter, and to buy her dowry

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.es:
Nazaria agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y por el apoyo brindado, ella continua con el negocio de la crianza de animales menores, a la ganadería y a la agricultura y le va excelente. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. 

Nazaria nació en el distrito de Challabamba pero vive en la comunidad de Majopata anexo de la comunidad de Carnicero y pertenece al banco comunal “El Balcon”. (La comunidad de Majopata está ubicada en el distrito del Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Nazaria is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan and the support that has been provided.  She continues her business of raising animals, breeding livestock, and farming.  Nazaria is doing well in all of these activities.  She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens.  

Nazaria was born in the District of Challabamba, but currently lives in the community of Majopata, which is next to the community of Carnicero.  She is a member of the Communal Bank "El Balcon".  The community of Majopata is located in the District of Challabamba, which in Paucartambo Province in the Department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Jacqueline Alexandra

texts.es:
Jacqueline tiene 32 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijo, vive con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

La VRC 27 DE MAYO sus miembros se ddeican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Cadial Practicamente se han criado en esa zona se dedican a labores agrícolas u Pecuarias en su mayoria.

Jacqueline  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de gallinas ponedoras. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza y una bomba para fumigar ademas de morocho y balanceado para las gallinas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras.

Las compras y las ventas las realiza en Ventanas.

El sueño es seguir sembrando para aumentar los cultivos. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 32 years old, single, and has two children. She and her children live in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank "27 de Mayo" (May 27th) are devoted to agriculture. All of them live in the area around the neighborhood of Cadial Practicamente where they grew up. Most of the members engage in farming and livestock breeding.

Jacqueline is a farmer who grows corn and raises egg-laying hens. She is requesting a loan in order to buy urea, insecticides, liquid weed killer, a fumigation pump, as well as maize and balanced feed for her hens. This loan will be a great help since she will be able to buy what she needs for her crops. Her purchases and sales are conducted in Ventanas.

Jacqueline's dream is to continue planting so that she can increase her crops. In her free time, she enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, liquid weed killer, a fumigation pump, as well as maize and balanced feed for her hens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy extra oil, bitter balls, pepper, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Eleodoro

texts.es:
Eleodoro tiene 42 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a sus hijos y esposa en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, ubicado en la región Cajamarca, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de labores agrícolas de arado, actividad que consiste en uncir a dos toros del mismo tamaño y colocar en el centro una herramienta que sirve para remover la tierra para prepararlo para los cultivos, también trabaja en siembra, cosecha, desyerbos te terrenos arroceros.

Ha solicitado un préstamo 1 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de toretes para seguir brindando el servicio de arado y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Eleodoro is 42 years old. He lives with his children and his wife in a house that he owns in the district of Pucará, a community known for its warm climate. The people there work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock production. It is two hours from the city of Jaén in the Cajamarca region on Peru's northern coast.

Eleodoro earns his living providing agricultural plowing services. This business consists of yoking two bulls of equal size with a tool centered between them to remove soil and prepare the land for planting. He also works in planting, harvesting, and weeding rice paddies.

He has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to invest in the purchase of young bulls to continue providing his plowing service so that he can generate a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a young bull

loans.name: José Rigoberto

texts.es:
José de 27 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador que a pesar de  haber estudiado hasta 6 grado de educación básica por su situación económica, él trata de buscar la forma de obtener ingresos para apoyar a su familia, la cual esta compuesta por su madre, dos hermanas y un hermano. También apoya  mediante su fuerza de trabajo, en su tiempo libre en las actividades agrícolas que desarrollan sus hermanos; anteriormente trabajaba en un agro-servicio, hoy en día se dedica a brindar sus servicios de seguridad en el Destacamento Militar.


José, también ha trabajado en la agricultura y sabe lo duro que es obtener los ingresos necesarios de tal labor, sumándole a esto el tiempo que se tarda en obtenerlos, por lo que él se motivo a buscar una fuente de ingresos mas estable, logrando encontrar trabajo en un agro servicio, en el cual trabajo durante tres años, hasta que decidió  prestar su servicio de seguridad dentro del Destacamento Militar,  en el cual lleva laborando ocho meses, de donde obtiene una fuente de ingresos mas segura.

Con el crédito se  le estará ayudando al cliente, para que pueda comenzar a construir una pequeña vivienda, la cual le servirá  mucho tanto a él como a su familia y también le servirá para  formar su propia familia en un  futuro.


 José  quiere en un futuro poder construir una casa digna y propia, donde pueda formar una familia a la cual pueda darles una mejor calidad de vida, teniendo su casa bien  equipada y amueblada.
texts.en:
Jose is 27 years old. He is a hardworking man despite having only studied until the 6th grade due to his financial situation. He tries to look for ways to obtain income in order to support his family, which is composed of his mother, two sisters, and one brother. He also supports them through his hard work. In his free time he works on agriculture projects that his siblings develop; he previously worked in agro-service. Nowadays he makes a living providing security services to the military detachment.

Jose has also worked in agriculture and knows how difficult it is to make the necessary income in that line of work. Due to this, it is taking a long time to make sufficient income. Because of that he was motivated to look for a more stable source of income; he was able to find agro-service work, in which he worked for three years until he decided to lend his services to security inside the military detachment. He has been working there for eight months and is receiving a more stable income. 

This loan will help the borrower be able to begin building a small home, which will help both him and his family; it will also help in the future when he starts his own family.

Jose wants a future in which he can build his own respectable house where he can start a family and give them a good quality of life, having a well-supplied and furnished house.

loans.use: to build a small home.

loans.name: Jubelyn

texts.en:
Jubelyn is 35 years old and married, with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jubelyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, spices, bread, chips, etc.

She has been in this business for 14 years.

In the future, Jubelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, spices, bread, chips, etc
